description:
OMFG! I used to come to this area for burritos, but not anymore. Gimme a lemon grass beef sandwich and iced coffee instead. 

Sandwich is perfect. The crunchy roll, the crispy sweet and tangy pickled vegetables, fresh jalapeños, and well seasoned beef. 

And less than $10! Yes, please!
author: Theresa D.

description:
Very good bahn mi at the right price!  Comes out to $6.50 with tax.  Small place inside - but perfect to call in an order and pickup.  

I got the chicken, which was very tasty.  Looking forward to trying the pork next time though.  

Only negatives were that the bread was a bit too crunchy, and the carrot to daicon ratio was a bit too heavy on the carrots.

Overall a good sando at the right price.
author: George M.

description:
I always wanted to try this place whenever i passes by this place especially that it is so close to where i live. I decided to the combination sandwich. Its $6.50 which includes tax. Kind of expensive for a Vietnamese sandwich. Bread was very crispy, it has fresh vegetables, good spread of the pate and mayo on the bread. It seems that theres more carrot than the meat..meaning that there wouldnt a lot of meat. But the sandwich was still good. Took a while for them to make my sandwich since it was a little busy especially that i came on a day when there was sunday street festival on the say i went

You can sit in but very limited since its very small place.

They also sell spring roll, bun thit nhung, and other

May come back again
author: Julie N.

description:
What a gem! 

I've probably passed this place many times now since I love Hawaiian Drive Inn which is right next door, but on a hot San Francisco day, I needed something a little more refreshing and bahn mi with a cold drink sounded amazing!

Walking in, you can immediately tell that it's a small operation, but what they offer is made extremely well in my opinion. I went with a #1, which is fancy pork with pate. If you opt for everything, you'll also get the regular fixins of carrots, cilantro, jalapeno onions, cucumbers, and mayo. I also paired it with a deep roasted oolong milk tea with boba.

The boba came out first, on first sip, it wasn't too sweet and you could definitely pick up on the roasted oolong flavor - definitely one of the better versions I've had, which actually puts a fair number of boba places to shame. The boba also had the right chew and sweetness. Shortly after, the sandwich came. On first look, I was a little disappointed at how thin the fancy pork was sliced, but otherwise, there was a good amount of pate and it was well stuffed with the fixins. 

But when I picked up the sandwich, that's when the magic happened! The bread crackled with a beautiful symphony of sounds and the everything just fell into place after. Overall, it was delicious. If I could change anything, I would probably ask for a little more mayo (kewpie mayo is noms).
author: Elaine Y.

description:
My wife wouldn't let me give anything other than 5 stars....and it's warranted! Great banh mi! I usually get the grilled pork, which is my barometer when it comes to quality banh mi. The baguette here is real good. It has a nice crunch, isn't tough (so you know it's fresh), and holds a good amount of toppings inside! The grilled pork has a ton of flavor! As others have said, it's juicy and tender. Pickled radish and carrots with fresh cilantro and a few slices of jalapeno and you're all set! 

This is our most frequented go-to banh mi spot in SF. Parking can be tough sometimes, but it's worth it. Prices here are less than those hipster banh mi spots that have been popping up around the Bay Area. Can't wait to go back (again!)
author: Aaron Y.

description:
Hella Good and fresh! 
Bread is soft mixed with the right amount of crunch
Veggies crisp
Chicken is very flavorful and moist

Bottom line I'll be back soon
author: T A.

description:
This is a small place with a few chairs and ideal for togo or a quick dine-in without table services. I ordered the lemongrass beef sandwich and a Vietnamese coffee for lunch, and I am happy with both though the beef is like ground beef instead of thinly sliced grilled beef. It tasted okay even though it is more like a big piece of ground meat on a sandwich. I will rather try the lemongrass pork next time to see if it is the sliced meat which I think has better texture and quality. The onion is raw if you are not a fan like me, then skip it. Overall a decent sandwich for $6. 

The coffee is very strong and sweet so I had to ask for a cup of iced water to dilute it. It is like buying one cup for two cups of coffee! Love it. 

Good place for a quick bite and good values.
author: Lena H.

description:
Metered street parking. 
This place is legit! My all time fave ban mi sandwich shop. They have a small in door eating area for probably a bout 8 pple
I usually call in my order and pick it up. You can customize your sandwich with less vegggies, no veggies, no jalapeños, etc. 
I usually get the BBQ chicken which is super juicy & tasty. Although it's grilled, it's never been dry or tasteless. It's got a great marinade in it. 
The family usually gets the BBQ pork which is full of flavor and easy or the palate. 
The mayo they use on the sandwich is delish!!!
I also like their shrimp spring rolls which comes with this yummy dipping sauce!
This is a Mom and pop owned shop, which I love supporting. They always answer the phone politely and are courteous taking my order. 
They also have a variety of drinks, boba, soda or chips. 
Everything tastes fresh & the sandwich is priced really well. Highly recommend!!
author: Andrea K.

description: I love their sandwiches...worth your money, just wish they cut their jalapeños thinner. Ones I got where pretty chunky...still delish
author: Miss S.

description:
This is my favorite banh mi place in the area. Yummy sandwiches full of 

We ordered:

Grilled pork sandwich - da bomb! Would order this again. Pork was moist juicy, tender and flavorful and all the veggies were fresh and ample. Meat portion was good too. Bread was soft yet textured and perfect. Some banh Mis have use a thicker bread, which scars up the mouth or leaves you taking off extra pieces- but this bread was perfect

Lemongrass chicken sandwich - YUM! Good alternative If you're not feeling the pork. Chicken was also flavorful.

Shrimp spring rolls - these I wouldn't order again- something about them made them bland. 

Parking is terrible but not impossible.

Not overly salted. Did not make me thirsty, this is a great sandwich place and I'll be back!
author: Karen H.

description:
What happened to you, TY?!?!? 

This was one of my favorite Vietnamese sandwich shops before, it was close by and the quality and portion was good (that was two years ago). Ever since I moved back to the Bay and went to TY for some sandwiches and spring rolls, I notice the quality of the food has dropped and the price had gone up. 

I understand you need to raise the price but that doesn't mean you need to drop the quality of food, there were barely any meat but instead was covered with veggies. The spring rolls didn't taste fresh as the outside layer of the roll was stiff and hard. I am very disappointed in them as it was much better quality and really enjoyed it, now it's definitely off my bookmarked list.
author: Stacey T.

description:
Looking for something good and affordable in SF?? Try one of these delicious Vietnamese sandwiches! 
You can choose tender chicken, beef, or pork, generously stuffed into a French roll and topped with fresh crunchy veggies. (There's also pâté if you're feeling adventurous.)

They also make these tiny, beautiful, crispy imperial rolls; fresh spring rolls; vermicelli noodle bowls; and a variety of milk teas with boba or jellies to choose from.

The place is small, capable of sitting about 8-10 people around a communal table. It looks newly remodeled for this part of town. Thankfully, they accept credit cards and are open M-Sat till 8pm and Sunday till 5pm.
author: Mitzi G.

description:
Just picked up a tofu sandwich here. All their sandwiches are 5.99, so with tax it's about 6.50.

I don't appreciate the guy at the register who took my cash touching my food without washing his hands or putting on gloves. That's just disgusting. No wonder they're trying to cover up they're health score of 89.... 

Bread is decent, crunchy outside and soft inside. 
Food is okay.
author: Karen M.

description:
Legit Vietnamese food, very affordable, limited seating, quick. 

Vermicelli, chicken, pork or meatball sandwiches and spring rolls are all very good.
author: T L.

description:
So seemingly random!

Found this place thanks to some good yelp reviews, and we weren't disappointed!

I ordered the Grilled Pork Banh Mi and it had a very generous portion of pork, as well as a fresh bun--which makes a world of difference.  I would say that it was probably one of the top 2 or 3 banh mi sandwiches i have had ANYWHERE...and i work with a lot of Vietnamese people, with whom i eat A LOT of Vietnamese food... so i am usually very surprised when i run into Vietnamese food that exceeds what we normally eat.

We also ordered a combination sandwich, which was completely devoured by our daughter--something that hardly ever happens unless it is unbelievably great.  She even ate all the crumbs and insisted she wasn't done even when i thought everything was eaten...there were still some crumbs left at that point.

One last thing.  If you like Vietnamese coffee, the coffee here is pretty strong, and the serving size for their small iced coffee is pretty sizable...closer to a medium or even large iced coffee elsewhere...so get your caffeine kick here as well!

Happy Eating!
author: Bradley H.

description:
Small seating area, great place to grab and go. Quick service. The lady at the front seems sweet.

They use a tablet to punch in the order and charge you through it. If you use a credit card, you do your signature on their screen which they flip over for you, and you can leave a tip on it too. 

Spring rolls with shrimp and pork- very good, everything was very flavorful. The peanut sauce here is so far my favorite, and they give you just enough to dip all 3 rolls.

Kinda pricey, I only ordered a banh mi and spring rolls and it was $13+. I'm used to paying less than $10 for both. But the shrimp, actually prawn they used are big, and they use a whole piece instead of slicing it in half.

Banh mi is pretty good, they really stuff the carrot/radish and spread a thick layer of pate in the sandwich. Bread was crispy and soft in the inside.

Worth trying, definitely getting the spring rolls here again and want to try the eggrolls. 

Enjoy!
author: Teena N.

description:
I love coming here, the sandwiches here at the best and at the best price I might add. 

You walk into this mom and pop shop and order from a small menu with about 7 different sandwiches. I usually get the combination which I think is the BEST. The pate is addicting and the bread is toasted just right. The sandwiches cost about $6 which is super full as I get full off it too. Best place to get Vietnamese sandwiches. 
Ty  TY Sandwich
author: Alberto S.

description:
This is the quintessential banh-mi shop in outer Mission. Priced at $5.99 for options for the meat eater and the picky vegetarian, you can add-on options too.

Their bread isn't too doughy, crisp without getting burnt, and pickled veggies to give you that umami feeling. You can pick the protein, and they have lots of choices. I like the lemongrass tofu, while the wife prefers grilled chicken banh-mi. 

The best part is you can order takeout online on Yelp, and get it ready within 10 minutes. 

Parking may be sketchy, but parking fairy usually works her charm on one of the side-streets.
author: Sam K.

description:
I give them high marks for their banh mi. While the size of the bread may not be Saigon Sandwich material, there was a good mix of the various ingredients (cilantro, pickled veggie, jalapeno and meat). You can taste the subtleness of the pate. 

Liked:
- # 1 Steamed Pork
- Shrimp spring roll
- Combo spring roll
- time from order to sandwich being ready
- boba thai tea

Overall a very good choice in this neighborhood. If I am in the area, definitely a stop. 

Cash only.
author: Steve L.

description:
The atmosphere: 
This place is teeny tiny! Only one table with 6 chairs. I would suggest picking it up to-go and just heading home if that's convenient enough for you. The vibe is pretty modern, the staff is nice enough...

The food: 
This was an OK sandwich. Overall there was nothing special about it; just your average Vietnamese chicken sandwich (6$). I was craving some pickled onions, or some basil, or mint along with the usual toppings (cilantro, carrot, lettuce, mayo) to kick it up a notch. Maybe some kind of spicy dipping sauce? Also the chicken was pretty dry and boring. This sandwich just needed some minor tweaking and it could have been so delicious! 

I also ordered the imperial rolls. These come with 8 1-2 bite sized rolls (6$). Great appetizer for sharing. They were overcooked though - the rice paper on the outside was burnt and had that charred taste that I love on a steak, but don't want on an egg roll....

The price: 
This place is very inexpensive. The sandwich was 6$, most things on the menu we between 3-6$. Definitely a good bang for your buck.
author: Taylor D.

description: After Dinosaurs went downhill, this is one of the best places for banh mi. Great people and great food.
author: Gordon Y.

description:
Wallet friendly prices, friendly service in a friendly neighbourhood. Always busy with the locals. 

Lemongrass chicken banh mi was great. 

Not much seating so this is not the place to eat and hang out. Most will get it to go and eat as they walk away.
author: Carmen P.

description: Combo sandwich: i like how the pate has a hint of garlic to it, but the pickle carrots were not pickled. It tasted bland. I ordered through yelp and my order wasnt ready when i got there. They didnt have my drinks ready, but good thing they were not busy so i didnt have to wait too long. My passion milk tea drink had more ice than milk tea:/
author: Melanie T.

description:
Little tiny sandwich shop! 

Ordered my food online through Yelp. Went to pick up my order on time, but when I got there, they were still prepping my food. I can't blame them for being late, since I rather want my food fresh/hot than cold. 

There's not much seating in the shop - about 4 seats to sit near the window and one table with a few seats. 

They got banh mi sandwiches, rice plates, noodles, spring rolls, and drinks (viet Iced coffee, Milk Tea, and other flavored fruit tea). 

The combination sandwich was good! They stuffed my sandwich with lots of carrots, and the bread had a good crunch. 

Would def stop by again!
author: Linda C.

description: Best grilled pork sandwich!! The owners are friendly, the sandwich shop is clean and the food is amazing and reasonably priced! My new favorite Vietnamese sandwich spot!
author: Mia M.

description: Bought three sandwiches. Plenty of carrots and fresh soft breads. Great value in the city.
author: Winglo A.

description: This is my local banh mi spot.  Delicious lemon grass tofu banh mi and Vietnamese ice coffee.  Great price point too.  Will be coming back still.
author: Julian C.

description:
Good, little pricey. I like having vegetarian options though aside from the norm I see at other viet sammich places.

I had the lemongrass tofu sammich. I'd say a little imbalanced on the ingredients in mine, way more carrots than anything else. I'm usually more of a fan of daikon and a bit more cilantro. The tofu was tasty, little bit chewy. I certainly like the bigger pieces of it tho in comparison with say shredded tofu that you see at a lot of other places. Makes for a better bite overall.
author: David C.

description:
I love this place. High-quality Vietnamese sandwiches and other Vietnamese delicacies at a reasonable price. Convenient location on Mission St in the heart of the Excelsior. Friendly, smiling staff. What else can you ask for?

So far I've tried the grilled pork and lemongrass beef sandwiches (both delicious), the shrimp and pork spring rolls (tasty, and the peanut sauce is great), and the Vietnamese iced coffee (deliciously sweet and a powerful pick-me-up). Looking forward to trying more of their dishes, in particular the pork vermicelli, and imperial rolls.

Ordering takeout through Yelp is a nice convenience too.
author: Nicholas F.

description:
Get Take out and It'll all be fine.

Great spot to get a Bahn-Mi and Vietnamese Coffee. Does have a small eating area but its more of a takeout place. I was there where a Kids Soccer team was making its way through the menu. Was slightly packed. Living around here made it easier to take To-Go. 

Lemongrass all the way. Though Grilled Pork is also good

Yelp Check-in got me some discount
author: Ashok R.

description:
I just love this place and now they accept cards! So friendly and they make their sandwiches with the freshest baked bread.
You guys rock!
author: Victor G.

description:
I love this place. 

Their sandwiches are always very tasty and the bread is always delivered fresh. I would always get the chicken or beef with lemongrass but no matter which one you get, you will not be disappointed. 

I'm actually sad I don't live right next door anymore. This place will be missed. The staff is always super friendly and the food is a good value. It's great to support a local business.
author: Katlyn H.

description: I generally get banh mi during the weekend or for my husband before his fishing trip. It was getting late to go to our usual spot so we found this local place. Its  small place and ordered 4 combination with a request to keep the veggies on the side so it doesn't get soggy for the next day. I noticed a lot of people order takeout. The  banh mi took quite a long time get done cooking, didn't think it would take that long. All in all very disappointed , they didn't follow my request by putting the veggies on the side, AND once we got home, the banh mi's were stuffed with veggies and maybe one or two slices of the fancy meat. And to top it off we paid about 6.50 a sandwich so all in all $30 bucks for some stuffed veggie sandwiches. Very disappointing, I hope the owners reconsider how they make these sandwiches and their price point.
author: Tiffany K.

description: I don't usually write reviews but I felt like I needed to share my experiences here. I gave them 3 chances. It's never consistent. First time I came their carrots were spoiled. 2nd time it was decent, carrots weren't spoiled. 3rd time, they literally gave 3-4 thin slices of meat and a shit load of carrots. I felt like I was eating a vegetarian sandwich! And I paid for extra pate... you can't even see the pate in this sandwich! Only reason why I'm giving them 2 stars is because the workers are nice but they need to step up their game. How this place got 4.5 stars amazes me.
author: Jennifer N.

description: Favorite banh mi spot this side of town. We always get the combo #1. They don't hold back on the meat, veggies, and pate. Bread is crunchy. Customer service is always friendly.
author: Jolene T.

description: Really good Banh Mi sandwiches. Best in SF? It might be. $5.99/sandwich is about what I would expect to pay now. Also bubble, flavored iced tea and Vietnamese coffee. The bubble and flavored (lychee) ice tea were good complements to the Banh Mi. Limited seating and street parking. I would come back here again.
author: Mark K.

description: This is my favorite Vietnamese sandwich place! I literally try and make it here at least once a week or every other week! Amazing sandwiches and boba tea :)
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Great bahn mi sandwich. Soft, yet crispy. Wallet-friendly prices. You won't be disappointed. 

Service has been friendly the past couple times I've visited. Just wish they'd be a bit more generous with the pate, but I think I'm just being excessive and glutenous. My obsession with pate. 

Small, but clean space inside. 

Loving this part of Mission Street.
author: Cameron M.

description: I normally came here for a sandwich and a cup of Thai tea. Their sandwich got fresh ingredients and big on size. You definitely can feed yourself with it. Their Thai tea could be too sweet for some but to me that is just simply perfect! You can use Yelp order online at this tiny local restaurant too! What can you ask more? If you love sandwich and Thai tea, you have to try at least once here!
author: Terry S.

description: I used to come here all the time when they first opened and the sandwiches were under $4. It was a great snack I'd usually grab two and an ice coffee but now pretty much everyone is charging over $6 for some chicken and a sprinkle of carrots and onions with a garnish of cilantro. No thanks! Its not worth it to me any more especially if I'm still going to be hungry after finishing it.
author: Yosof R.

description:
I love TY Sandwich, their Banh Mis are sooo good! I literally come here once a week, sometimes twice. I've tried many Banh Mis and I have to say, they have the BEST! They're my to go when I need my fix.

The owners are very kind and friendly. My husband and I go there so often, they know our order by heart and always starts conversations with us :)

I get #3 Combination and my husband gets #8 Lemongrass beef, both super yummy! The bread is cruncy n crisp on the outside and soft n warm in the inside, they give a generous amount of meat and the right amount of carrots, cucumbers n cilantro. The meat is super flavorful, it's the perfect mix of savory and fresh from the veggies. I LOVE anything pickled, so I appreciate that they pack their sandwiches with a lot of pickled carrots. 

I get the spring rolls when I'm craving something fresh, delicious! Their chicken rice plates are yummy too and the lemongrass tofu sandwich. You really can't go wrong with any of their sandwiches. They also have milk tea boba's :P

If you're ever in the area and you want a fresh, flavorful and delcious sandwich, you should definetly check this place out! The food will not disappoint!
author: Jean C.

description:
Meh, based on the ratings I definitely had high hopes for this place...but it really wasn't anything that special to me :(

Service was great - I was greeted by a sweet lady at the register. She was very nice and courteous. Very accommodating when I requested the bread for the banh mi to be toasted bc I like my sandwich with a crunch. 

Moving onto the food - I ordered a grilled pork banh mi and two orders of the shrimp and bbq pork spring rolls. I'll admit that the bbq pork was juicy and the banh mi bread was definitely fresh, but it was just way too salty for my taste...I had to wash it down with so much water! As for the spring rolls, I love that the wrap isn't too thick like other places and the peanut sauce is pretty good. 

All in all, I'm glad I got to try this place out but I wouldn't bust a mission to come back.
author: Coco L.

description: Hidden gem in Outer Mission. Excellent Banh Mi sandwiches, and speedy service. What more do you need?
author: Kyle K.

description:
I tell everyone about this tiny sandwich spot! I just want to share it with the world because it is so bomb. Anderson knows my order and always gets me with their delicious Vietnamese ice coffee, paired with a grilled chicken sandwich, extra jalapeños.  

10% off if you check in on Yelp too!
author: Pnut B.

description: Ty Sandwich, you know the way to my heart. With your flaky, yet chewy delicious baguette, and your luscious loads of cucumber, carrots, and onions, and your savory meats, you make me melt. For $6.50, you get a sandwich (the combo, of course) that could rival any other. It's spicy, savory, slightly gamey from the pate, and ridiculously rich. You can't have just one bite, and you'll thank me later that you didn't. Wait time? Minimal. 5-10 minutes to order and get your chunk of Heaven. Excellent portions, great customer service. Can't ask for more.
author: Danny C.

description:
I'm an avid bahn mi lover honestly and wow. This spot hits the spot, the baguette is literally toasted to perfection and so is the marinated meats!! 

Simple affordable food with an amazing taste. I'd definitely come by!
author: Murielle Joy T.

description:
CASH only. Mission Street is a busy street so finding parking can be a challenge.

The staff are always very friendly. There are a couple of high counters and a few seats if you want to eat there or just sit while waiting for your order, but most people just order to go since it's a very small shop. 

They're a bit pricey for vietnamese food but if I am in the area and want something to-go real quick, it's a decent option.

Vietnamese coffee (3 stars) - most places have only one size (equivalent to a size medium) but Ty have three sizes: small ($3.50), medium ($4.50), and large ($5.50). Tastes like your average vietnamese coffee, sweetened by condensed milk and has that strong, roasted coffee taste. Nothing special.

Roasted Oolong Milk tea w/ Boba (1.5 stars; $3.50) - The boba is completely bland and some are still bunched up. I actually just asked for the milk tea, which I didn't know comes with boba without being requested. I ended up just scooping out all the boba. Their so-called "Roasted Oolong Milk tea" tasted just like the Chinese brand of instant milk tea called "3:15pm Roasted Milk Tea", very sweet and artificial. 

Bbq pork & egg roll vermicelli (4 stars; $8.50) - The dish comes with two short stubs of (oily) egg rolls cut in half, grilled pork pieces, wide strips of lettuce, shredded carrots, vermicelli, and fish sauce. Egg rolls are pretty good, stuffed with taro, wood ear, vermicelli. Yum, just wish that the lettuce is shredded thinner...Too picky? Maybe, but everywhere else, they have it shredded very thinly and it's easier to mix in with the vermicelli!

I usually like to check my order before I leave. Out of several times I've gotten this, there was only one incident of them forgetting the egg rolls in my order, but I caught it before I left. They were apologetic and made the egg rolls for me right away. 

** General tip: Always double check your to-go order before leaving. **

They also sell prepacked shrimp/pork spring rolls ($6.00; 3 rolls with peanut sauce) at the counter next to the register. They're okay.

Will visit again for a quick fix but only occasionally since it is a bit pricier than other vietnamese places.
author: Amy T.

description: For how good the pork and chicken bahn mi style sandwiches are, I feel guilty paying only $5.99 a pop. The sweet n salty blend with perfect texture is located between a fresh roll. Best deal in town for Vietnamese sandwiches.
author: Kevin G.

description:
Love this place. Service friendly n fast.  Great Value. Tons of fresh veggies in each sandwich. 
I ordered #1 off the new menu updated two weeks ago.
Bread is fresh, Nice portion of veggies.  Love the pate spread with the steamed pork. Winner
author: Pure M.

description:
Came here with high hopes for some good tasting banh mi but received the opposite. I've tried a variety of products and was hoping to change my perspective on my visit. CASH ONLY! We ordered the Combo (#3), Grilled Chicken (#4), Spring Rolls (#10), a Thai tea, and milk tea (both with boba). All for Take-Out since the interior was pretty small.

BEWARE! One main reason why I resorted to a 2 star rating was because our milk tea was made with SPOILED MILK. A couple sips in, I noticed it tasted sour. I called them inquiring whether it should resemble a sour/lemon taste and they sounded surprised - which I think was their way of saying "no it shouldn't." Thankfully they offered a complimentary milk tea, but I graciously declined since I had left the area and was too far from the shop.

As for the other items... I personally tackled on the Grilled Chicken #3 and I felt that the sauce was not evenly distributed throughout the sandwich. I also forgot to ask for pate so that may be another reason. But based on their high rating, I was expecting something tastier. Their spring rolls didn't have mint and was pretty bland. Their spring roll sauce lacked hoisen sauce as well so maybe try asking for some extra before you leave.

Overall, this place has potential and is located right on Mission. Parking may be a hassle, but if you're not staying too long the Safeway lot is located close by. I hope to return sometime in the future to alter my perspective and hopefully have a more successful visit next time.
author: Jana V.

description: My new favorite Vietnamese sandwich place. Fresh bread, plenty of filing and always nice people at the counter!
author: Lee J.

description:
Best banh mi ever.Ty Sandwich is fast, friendly, delicious and affordable!The sandwich was really flavorful and the meat was cooked well.Their tofu banh mi is delicious.
I will be back.Thanks lovely ladies!
author: Natalie N.

description: $5.99 + tax for a banh mi???? I guess I'm used to Saigon Sandwich prices which have been slowly creeping up. Nevertheless, $6 for a banh mi is pretty steep even in the land of $12 avocado toast. Quality of the sandwiches were solid 4-stars. I guess if you're in the area and the craving is hitting hard then sure.
author: Stephen Y.

description: Love this tiny joint which surfs on the Banh Mi wave.  The sandwiches are generously stuffed w/ the marinated carrots, daikon and cucumbers and meat of your choice. The bread is perfect. The ingredients are FRESH and plentiful.  Prices have risen from $ 5 to I think $7 or $8 which has not lessened demand for Ty's high quality sandwich.
author: Matsuo U.

description: Best Vietnamese sandwich in the city. Can't believe it took my so long to come here. Another good one is on 35th and clement because it's cheaper. The quality here is unparalleled. Best bread. Rose tea good too. And the service is awesome
author: Mishari A.

description:
It's been two days and I'm still thinking about their grilled pork sandwich.

I needed some food to keep me going as I wandered through the city. Banh mi seemed like a solid choice and Ty Sandwich was just down the street. I had their grilled pork sandwich and it kept me energized, happy, and full. 

The bread was flaky, warm, and fresh. They give a generous portion of pork and it was cooked perfectly with none of that unnecessary fat. You can actually see and smell the meat grilled up as you sit and wait for your order. Honestly, banh mi is such a simple sandwich, but it requires properly prepared ingredients to make it memorable.

This was $5 well spent. Definitely stopping by for another visit the next time I'm in Excelsior!
author: Jessica H.

description:
If you live in the neighborhood, you've got to try this place at least once! We love their food, the prices and the owners are so kind. We probably go here at least 3 times a month. 

We usually order the grilled pork sandwiches, generous meat portion. 

When I feel like going vegan, I order the tofu sandwich. The tofu is marinated and cut into correctly sized cubes. The tofu sandwich is hot, very flavorful and satisfying.
author: Marie L.

description:
Great little sandwich place in the neighborhood. Sandwiches are about $7 and they give you a healthy portion. The flavor of the sandwiches are great as well and the vegetable toppings and the baguette taste very fresh. For people who can't handle spice well you may want to remove the jalapenos that they put in but personally I don't think a banh mi is complete without them. They have other items on the menu as well that I haven't tried such as vermicelli and spring rolls, but the sandwiches is what you want to try in this place. 

There are some seats in this place but not much. There are about 6 spots around a table and maybe 5 to 6 bar type seats along the window and wall. I typically come here and do a take out.

The parking is tough around the area, but you can sometimes find a spot near the shop in one of the neighboring streets. Since i live in the area i just walk, but i would suggest order online go in and pick up.
author: Moses L.

description: The best Banh Mi sandwich store around! The bread is very flaky, not hard and over crunchy where it rips your mouth apart. Warm and toasty, filled with tender meat and crunchy veggies. Awesome! My go to is the #3 with Vietnamese pork roll, ham, and pate with fresh, crispy veggies.
author: Torien N.

description: I love this restaurant so much! I've been here about 5 times now and they are just the sweetest sandwich shop around. Their honeydew milk tea and taro milk tea tastes authentic and delicious as well. They even give out a $1 discount if you go to the local school. Definitely becoming one of my go-to's for a quick and satisfying lunch.
author: Vivian C.

description: The best. One of my favorite SF sandwich shops period. Great food, great service and GREAT Prices. I recommend this shop to everyone looking for a filling meal on a small budget or anyone who's just in town that wants to try the local flavor. You'll be highly impressed I promise. Get the Tofu. Whew. Good stuff.
author: Louis N.

description: I ordered a combination sandwich, and they gave me a meatball sandwich instead. It was still good, especially since it was only $5. It's a quality banh mi with fresh baguettes and fast service.
author: Ha D.

description: 2nd time coming here, and confirmed - the best banh mi in the Bay area in my opinion.  It's all about the bread, and Ty sandwich has the flakiest light rice flour baguette (authentic) that perfectly compliments the savoriness of the meat and sour of the pickled vegetables.  Only complaint is that their prices seem to be going up every 6 months - at $6.50 a sandwich after taxes, it's becoming less of a value play.
author: Jeff P.

description: It was our first a time there. A nice little whole in the wall restaurant. Simple, fast and good. FYI they do put onions in their sandwiches, which I'm not a huge fan of. Definitely reasonably priced for SF, I would go back.
author: Czarina H.

description:
Love this place! Reminds me of all my banh mi spots in Oakland.  It's cheap,  good,  and never disappoints. 

 I ordered the grilled pork vermicelli and asked if it could be wrapped in rice paper and the woman who worked there was sweet enough to do it for me :)
author: Hieu H.

description:
Gem in the Mission!!! Two thumbs way up!

You'll get a huge sandwich for a decent price. They only charge 50 cents for extras and they don't skimp on any of it. I had to save the other half for the next day. 

The only downside is parking, unless you live in the neighborhood, and can walk to it (consider yourself lucky). I have a dream, one day, they will help the lazy people like me and offer delivery or pair up with a food delivery vendor...one day!
author: Tammy S.

description: I've been coming here for 2 years. It's a tiny place but the sandwiches are so good! They've never messed up on my to-go overs ever either. Highly recommended!
author: Vicky L.

description:
Ever since moving to SF, I've been hunting for some delicious Bahn Mi. So many places offer this heavenly sandwich combination of pork, cucumber, cilantro, and pickled carrots in a toasted baguette, yet all of them seem to disappoint one way or another. One place had soggy bread, the other place had barely any pork, and still another one used unpickled carrots. Not Ty. For delicious, reasonably priced Bahn Mi, there is no better place than Ty Sandwich. 

The restaurant is small, but there is a sitting area if you're so inclined. The pork is cooked to order, and everything is prepared once you pay. Will come again.
author: Jeffrey Y.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE. I've been coming here for a few years now, and it always delivers. I used to order the grilled pork sandwich and it was always soooo flavorful and perfectly balanced with the pickled veggies inside. About a year ago, I became vegetarian and switched to the lemongrass tofu sandwich and it is even better than the grilled pork. The tofu is so juicy and crispy (I think it's fried ?). Also, the owners are super friendly and cute. 10/10 would recommend.
author: Emilia V.

description:
Such a serious find
for a part of the City I've exclusively associated with outstanding taquerias.
is that wrong?

Anyways,
where other bahn mi spots have failed to capture that integral balance of crunch from the french roll, savory from properly prepared proteins, and the million of other ingredients that give bahn mi varying textures, heat, and that bit of sweet, TY sandwich has completely got it.  This is especially awesome considering how often I find myself in and around the neighborhood.

It's a small shop that's run by two of the friendliest people you'll ever meet. They're constantly buzzing around getting orders out so I usually call ahead as not to take up valuable space that could be otherwise used for folks who want to sit and eat.  And if my food isn't ready by the time I get there, they're so super apologetic that I have to assure them that it's no big deal.  Good peoples.

Furthermore, this migration of tasty bahn mi beyond the confines of the Tenderloin (in relation to the City) may have taken longer than I had expected but now that it has, I will, in most likelihood, relentlessly frequent it until I've either gotten my fill or start craving something else. 

ty Ty sandwich. ty.

hey Yelp,
when can I start using emoticons in my reviews?
the written word is slowly becoming obsolete and I need a new means of expression here.
https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/4e/5c/f7/4e5cf7d4ccb9c59b6620a9c71944d51e.jpg
author: Dan B.

description: This is a great little hole-in-the-wall sandwich shop.  I always get the combination sandwich and my toddler devours the rice plates.  Their Vietnamese iced coffee is great too (better than Turtle Tower).
author: Julie L.

description: I got the combo, meatball, and grilled pork sandwiches--and they were all lacking in flavor. The carrots (no daikon!) we're not pickled enough and the big chunks of raw white onion was really overpowering.
author: Jesse D.

description:
The best sandwiches around. Friendly, easy to order in advance, party orders are great. 
Delicious combo and pork Sandwiches.
author: Olga V.

description: Every damn time I come here and ask for NO JALAPEÑO, they give them to me! Don't acknowledge you understand what I'm saying if you really don't! SERIOUSLY WTFFFFF. What if someone has an allergy to something and you still give it? You guys can get sued and go out of business. I need to take my business elsewhere. You guys raised your prices also. $5 and up for a viet sandwich is ridiculous.
author: Lola L.

description:
Hands down, top Vietnamese Sandwich spot in San Francisco! Being a usual here, this review is far over due. I always will place my order via phone and pick it up within 10-15 minutes; which always seems to be very appreciated by the friend staff. Tiny place on Mission with seating for about 8. A must stop-by, drop-in or pick-up place when in the area. Recently expanded their menu and have raised their prices every year since being in business. Cant complain, because they really are the best Banh Bi shop in SF. 

Also, they now accept credit card.. which is a huge plus! 

Two #1's, one with no onions please!
author: T N.

description:
Yeah, I'm a huge fan of their bahn mi. GET THE COMBO!!! I can't emphasize that enough. It's delicious! The pate and everything around it really make this sandwich great. It's so good, you might really get addicted. Not only that, but it only costs you around $5.99 for a decent meal. I've also tried the grilled pork, which is also good. In comparison, I've had a few other bahn mi joints besides this, such as Saigon Sandwich in the TL as well as Dinosaurs on Ocean and Market. I feel that TY's really hit the spot. 

What I also really enjoy about TY's is that they really make an effort to remember their regulars. They know what my bf and I like and tend to ask why we haven't come to visit them for a while. They're sweet and welcoming people. 

They are NO LONGER CASH ONLY.
author: Lyra C.

description: WHAT A DEAL! The best $6 sandwich you could ask for. Saucy and clean and fresh. And the shop itself is just as neat and trendy. I don't know how they get away with such a bargain, but it will bring me back for sure!
author: Rich W.

description:
Friendly, fast and engaging customer service! The clerk always knew my exact order and never failed to ask how my day was. On top of that, the affordable and delicious sandwiches kept bringing me back. 
The downside to it all, would be me not attending the school near here anymore, and parking is quite hard to find. Though the sandwich makes it worthwhile. Must try!
author: Len D.

description: This place is near my house so whenever I crave banh mi's, this is my go to. I've tried the beef, pork and chicken. I always gravitate towards the grilled chicken.  Their Thai iced tea is not bad either. Prices are very reasonable, $5 for a sandwich. Cheaper than subway lol. Small place but there are a few tables to sit when dining in. Not good for large parties. You can also order online and pick up. The staff is very nice as well. I came in at about 7pm and they did run out of the rice bowl but no biggie. Street parking only.
author: Bj S.

description: Good vietnamese sandwiches for the price. Small little mom and pops shop with great variety.
author: Nelson H.

description:
So far, Ty makes the best banh mi sandwiches in the Excelsior neighborhood. Much better than the banh mi from Mission Noodle House just a few doors down.

After the kitchen remodel in August 2015, sandwich prices have gone up by 50 cents, but $4.50 is still a very good deal. The cold cuts (steamed pork, ham+pate) banh mis are now $4.25 (was $3.75).

New menu items = Bubble milk tea ($3, regular, taro, mango, strawberry, or honeydew). There's now a lemongrass beef (beef meatballs) banh mi. The rice plate (white rice, fried egg, 2 mini rolls + choice of grilled pork or grilled chicken) is still $7, but now there's also a vermicelli bowl (similar to the plate but with rice noodles, same choice of meats, but no egg) for $7 too. And the previously unlisted fried imperial rolls (8 mini rolls for $5.25) are now included on the menu board.

Service is also much faster now. Yesterday, I got my order in under 5 minutes. In the past, I often had to wait 10-30 minutes. Service has always been very friendly.

My favorite banh mi are the grilled chicken and the grilled pork. For some strange reason, yesterday my sandwich had some unusually strong raw onions (not soaked or pickled) inside. Otherwise, as good as always, with a few jalapeno slices for heat, and a good crunchy crust bread.

FYI, I was told that the name "Ty" is the owner's nickname (I think his name is Huynh).

After the remodel, the shop now offers catering and delivery service (call for info). The shop isn't listed in Yelp's Eat24, but u can order a limited menu for pickup on Yelp online. GrubHub menu prices add 25 cents more per item (min. $20 order).

Hours: 9:30am-8pm daily
Cash only.
author: Luis C.

description:
The sandwiches are good, it's location makes them great. Let's be honest here, $5 for a sandwich not that expensive(anymore). We're not in San Jose, and this isn't early 2000s where a sandwich from Little Paris is like $1.50. Heck, even Turtle Tower on 6th is charging at least that much for a little turd sandwich. I live in DC and this is our go to place for Viet Sandwiches. Bread to me is the most important thing and the bread here is good. Served warm, crunchy and soft. The option to add an egg is nice, but not really needed. 

Anyway, like the spot. It's not TL good, but definitely great for the area. Would have no problem recommending it and continue to eat here. If you're picking up, order ahead. Street parking is usually ok on weekdays.
author: Jin S.

description:
I love getting the chicken Banh mi sandwiches here, especially when I need to grab food for a hike. The service is really fast and the quality of the food is really good relative to the prices. 

If you purchase in-person, you can only pay with cash. If you don't have cash on hand, a trick is to order through Yelp and pay with your card.
author: Tenzin K.

description: Really really basic banh mis and rolls. I got the chicken banh mi as well as the shrimp rolls. Pretty bland and flavorless for a banh mi and there are a lot better choices for a Vietnamese style sandwich in the city. They're also cash only and don't take card at the store  but you can order through yelp/eat24 once I got there since I didn't have cash on hand.
author: Navdeep D.

description: By far the best tofu sandwich I ever had and I strongly recommend to everybody to come and check this out. They have the best service the very nice and generous I'm enjoying to come and eat over here when I have a chance
author: Yehuda B.

description:
Oh...it smells so good in here.

The cashier (owner maybe?) was actually nice.  Genuinely warm & nice.  That never happens, right?

I was set on the grilled pork & the meatball.  Thanks to Yelp, I never walk into a restaurant for the first time without already having full command of the menu & knowing what each dish looks like.  This is the age of "informed ordering."  Knowledge is power.

It's a tiny spot that seats maybe 8 people.  

It's very clean.

It cranks out an impressive amount of banh mi sandwiches.  I hear it's out the door at lunch everyday.  When I came in, about a half hour before closing, there were 2 members of SF's finest waiting for their orders.  SFPD approved?  Good sign.  

1 grilled pork.  $4.50.
1 meatball.  $4.50.
1 order of fried spring rolls.  $5.25.

What?!  2 meals w an appetizer for around 15 bucks?!  

Marveling at this made me feel silly for not coming here sooner.  That whole "how long has this been going on without me?" moment.

I put the sandwiches & the fried spring rolls in the backseat.  The aromas in the car were off the hook.  I could hardly wait until I got home.

The sandwiches aren't skimpy either, especially considering the price.

Both sammies were very good.  But the grilled pork was our favorite.  The flavors are strong, the carrots & cucumber so fresh, the meat seasoned & tender.  The bread crispy outside & soft inside.  Just fabulous.  

The fried spring rolls fell a little flat for me.  They were pretty mediocre.  I think I should have went for the fresh spring rolls instead.  But the banh mi being so great makes up for it.

The quality & value are almost unbelievable.  I'm ashamed to say that I pay $4.50 (or more) for a latte almost daily.  The fact that I can get such a fresh, delicious meal for the same price restores a little faith in city living.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
It's a good day in the hood! 

When this place first opened I wasn't too sure how I felt about it but after trying it a couple of times I think it's safe to say that this is the best banh mi shop in this part of town. 
The ingredients (especially the meats) are really fresh and you can taste it! I had the #6, grilled pork, and it was great, combination fancy pork and pate also great. They use the crunchy kind of bread but its not too flakey. 
The lady that works there is super friendly and seems genuinely glad to help you!

I used to drive all the way to Irving Deli or Little Paris to get a good banh mi but now I can say that we have a solid viet sandwich shop in this area.

Iced Coffee is also great. Cash only. 

Added Bonus: Right next to Hawaiian Drive-Inn and El Farolito.
author: Antonio W.

description: Definitely one of my favorite spots to grab food in my neighborhood. The imperial rolls are delicious! I usually get the grilled pork or lemongrass beef sandwich, but you can't go wrong with any of their sandwiches. Also, the owners are super nice and friendly!
author: Melaniy S.

description: Their authentic egg rolls were served piping hot, crispy & very yummy.  I ordered a grilled pork sandwich which was loaded with meat and the other fillings - One of the best Vietnamese sandwiches I ever had! Am glad it's in the neighborhood!
author: Anne G.

description: Ordered the fancy pork banh mi. It was ok. A little much on the vegetables. Needed more fancy pork and pate. The thai ice tea was good. I will need to try the other bahn mi sandwiches, the next time i am in the area. The rice dishes looked good also.
author: Andy L.

description:
TY sandwiches are so good, I keep coming back and back and back! They serve best Banh Mi! I switch between tofu and BBQ pork, can't go wrong either way!
I also order the Thai iced tea, mmmmm. The owners are really friendly and nice. Service is quick. Eat here or take to go. Where ever it's a can't miss great meal!
author: David P.

description: Lemongrass tofu Sandwich is always great! If you haven't had it I highly recommend you try it out.
author: Michael S.

description: I am a fan of their sandwiches, especially their combination. However, today's combination sandwich is mostly veggies with a lot less meat than usual. Plus most disappointing is their bread, it has always been lightly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Today, it is hard and have a thicker dough than in the past.   Hopefully, it is just an off day! Their pork and shrimp spring rolls are still great as usual though, very fresh and tasty marinated pork with a flavorful peanut sauce.
author: Priscilla A.

description:
This is the best banh mi I've had in San Francisco.  The bread really makes it.  It's perfectly toasted and crisp on the outside.  The crust is flaky and crumbles upon biting into it.  Meanwhile, the inside is soft and airy.  I order extra pate and it is delicious.  So far I've only had the combination pork and it's a winner.  I will be back to try different variations.

Parking can be difficult in this area, but it is worth it to have the perfect Vietnamese sandwich!
author: Howard H.

description:
I have been coming here for years and I love this place. They are always so welcoming and make your food quick. When they added the bobba drinks this was officially my place to buy sandwiches and bobba. I no longer go anywhere else. 

A big plus now is they added to pay with debit card :)
author: Yessy C.

description: Went there this morning at 10 am. No one there at all. Stools were up on counter. Need to get some sandwiches and get on a flight. Very unreliable shop. Just like another reviewer said price went up so steep.
author: Robin N.

description:
Good banh mi here.  The lemongrass beef was very tasty.  Generous with the amount of meat you get for the price.

DO NOT get the fresh spring rolls here.  The peanut sauce is weak af and they put too much noodles in there.
author: Baek C.

description: Good, affordable, quick. This is my go to spot when I need a quick bite as well as when out of town friends/family visit and i want to have food ready for when they land.
author: Brandon L.

description: Excellent Bahn Mi's for a very good price. Really good service in a small little restaurant. Food is fresh and it tasted delicious. Would come here again.
author: Axel M.

description: I come here at least twice a month or so when i do not know what to eat. I always order their combination sandwich with no onions. They are very consistence in their portion and service. The staff is super friendly here and you can always call a head and order so you dont have to wait. There is also almost never any parking on mission so if you are coming here alone, it can be hard. You can also order a head on the yelp app to pick up. They also serve drinks!
author: Jan H.

description:
Best soup in town! Cheap, tasty bahn mi sandwiches and Perfect amount of meat and veggies. 
Great food and tea! Low prices and friendly service.
author: Patricia F.

description: This is a pretty good place at a reasonable price. The bread is soft and warm and grilled pork with mild spiciness makes it savory. A really good sandwich.
author: Edward L.

description: Excellent vegi bahn mi sandwich. Great Vietnamese iced coffee. They can add pearls too.
author: Glenn R.

description:
Pork spring rolls had pork, noodle, and lettuce only, idk if thats how they really make it or if they just skimped my rolls.
Peanut sauce is runnier than i'd like.
author: Doby H.

description: I love this place except when i order take out, i request no jalapeño because i absolutely cannot take spicy. i assume they would put no jalapeños in and i bite into it and i get a mouth full of spice. currently crying because my mouth is burning.
author: Sandy L.

description:
No bbq pork here, so I opted for the grilled pork sandwich ($5) which was equally as yummy. There was a ton of carrots, and they don't shred them as well as other places which meant I did have to pluck some out on my own to reduce the overwhelming carrot flavor. Aside from that easy fix, I think it's a solid place. I love the crunchy french roll bread. 

Parking - depending on your luck. I came on a Sunday mid-morning and it was a little tough.
author: Jess W.

description:
I was at a nearby yoga place, so decided to stop by to try their sandwiches!!

Bread:  I must say, the rage must be about their bread!  It was crunchy on the outside, but when you bite into it, it was so soft!!!

Pate:  I like mine with a bit more pate and a little saltier.  I could barely taste the pate on my sandwich.

Meat:  Is it weird that I like my sandwiches with less meat?  They PACKED it with the lemongrass beef!  So if you like lots of meat, you'll like it.  I thought it overpowered the sandwich.  I also tried the combo banh mi.  It wasn't as tasty as I remembered when I had banh mi's at other restaurants.

I also ordered the fresh spring rolls and they were a disappointment.  There were only vermicelli noodles, lettuce, and shrimp.  (and the cost was $5!)  A nice tasty spring roll should also have mint, other herbs, etc.  

So between the banh mi's and the spring rolls, I would give it 3.5 stars.  If you're in the area, definitely stop by for a sandwich!!!!  If you're far, then I wouldn't trek all the way out to get their sandwiches.  There are plenty in SF that are just as good!
author: Nutmeg Y.

description: OMG Yummmy n tasty sandwiches.. 3 of the regular combo to share with friends .. Amazing lite toast bread.. All the fixing with jalapeño peppers is a plus.. Is a must come back again for me..well worth every bite.. And the price is Grreat !!!
author: Crisy G.

description: With the high rating star I was expecting a good Vietnamese sandwich, price was ok. The place is small so really just good for take out only. First of all the cashier not paying attention when we are placing an order had to repeated few times before getting it right, we order the fancy pork with pate, got home and open it and discovered that the pate is missing, sandwich is to much overload carrots and big slice of cucumber not much of jalapeño either. All I can taste is the carrots. Drink wise ordered Oolong milk tea I would say it was an average taste but my husband ordered taro milk tea and it has a funny taste. And yes we know the good taro milk tea cause we tried a lot of places so it's not that I'm over exaggerating with my review....
author: Lyn D.

description:
I had just picked up three boxes from the post office and found myself at one of the most delicious corners in Excelsior. The smell of delicious grilled chicken permeated the area, but it's source was an unknown: did it come from Guadalajara, El Farrolito, Hawaiian Drive In (which isn't a drive in at all!), the new Guatemalan Yo Soy Cafe? Unfortunately I copped out and went to TY Sandwich instead because I knew it would be enough for a single meal.

TY does have a lot of cheap options, as I think the most expensive sandwich is $6. They offer I think 10 Banh mi options, chicken wings, a few rolls, and rice bowl options. Oh, and boba too!

I went with the #6 and #11: roast pork sandwich and spring rolls. Now normally I would go with the combination banh mi, but I wanted something a bit warmer on this cold day and it was a solid sandwich. Bread was good, meat was cheap but good. The spring rolls were also solid, even having some as leftovers last night. While ordering someone got the meat ball special, and another got an order of fresh rolls. Looking forward to trying those.

So if in the area and looking for a cheap option for a single meal, hard to beat TY.
author: Michael C.

description: This is my favorite banh mi place. I always get combination sandwich! I ask them to take out the cilantro, and they never mess up. The owner is always happy to see us and says hi whenever we come by. Been coming here for a couple years now!
author: Beverly L.

description:
I was yearning for a delicious banh mi and wanted to be able to order and pick up. Through yelp I was able to find Ty Sandwich shop. I ordered three grilled pork sandwiches (#6) - one with pate that they did not charge extra for, each one costs  $4.75. I then also ordered two grilled chicken sandwiches for $4.50 ($6)and fresh spring rolls for $5.25 (#10) with shrimp only no pork.

With all these instructions, they were able to correctly make everything with no problems at all. I called to let them know I was coming to give them a heads up and were very nice on the phone. 

It's a small shop with very few tables and high chairs but taking food to go is easy peezy - definitely recommend taking it to go, parking may be a hassle with street parking in the mission, but definitely worth it.

I'd order everything again, especially through the Eat24 app, but the fresh spring rolls didn't knock my socks off.
author: Kathleene E.

description:
I'm sad because I really like this place! Ordered pickup through Eat 24 and I ordered a Grilled Chicken Banh Mi and Spring Rolls. What I got! I got a Grilled Beef Banh Mi instead!!! I mean it's still good but I was looking forward to the chicken. 

The Spring Rolls, the shrimp inside seemed rubbery meaning it was cooked probably earlier in the day and now it's cold. I mean it's still edible, plus they added MEAT inside my roll and guess what meat? CHICKEN? Ugh I hope next time when I choose to go out of my way and look for parking around Mission that they get my order right :(
author: Vanessa Z.

description:
A little pricey for a typical Vietnamese sandwich ($5 + tax to about $5.43). Very small shop across from Safeway but a few chairs for those who like to dine solo like me. There are about 10 options for sandwiches on their menu plus some spring rolls.

Bread was nicely toasted and crunchy and they loaded it up with meat and paste. Size was just enough. Not anything amazing or out of the ordinary. Cash only.
author: Cheri S.

description:
I love Ty Sandwich. I really do. Along with Taqueria Guadalara across the street and Hawaiian Drive-Inn next door, Ty Sandwich completes a perilous Excelsior Bermuda Triangle of food in which one disappear and never emerges again, surrounded by delicious food. Their meatball, grilled pork, and lemongrass beef sandwiches are all delicious, but I tend to judge banh mi shops by their dac biet-- Ty Sandwich delivers. The pate is ample, the coldcuts and steamed pork flavorful, and all the pickled veggies are always a clean contrast to their fluffy and toasty baguettes.

I love getting banh mi for lunch, chatting briefly with the owners in Vietnamese while sipping a rich Vietnamese iced coffee, and I hope more people come by (with cash!) to support a lovely local business.
author: Annie P.

description: Love this sandwich joint. Reasonable and super good. They fill up the sandwiches with meat! Bread is toasted perfectly. Thai iced tea w/boba is also good. My sister also recommends the spring rolls.
author: Eka d.

description:
This is definitely my favorite banh mi place in SF right now, over Saigon Sandwiches and Dinosaurs. My friends and I decided to pick up dinner here and looked up the menu on Yelp so we could call in it beforehand. The lady who answered the phone was super sweet and spoke good English, and said our order would be ready in 10-15 minutes. Highly recommended to do take-out since the place is super small. Our order was ready when we got there, and we tried:

-House Chicken Wings ($5.25, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ty-sandwich-san-francisco?select=quPIOaOAlCryq5fgiM2_LQ#quPIOaOAlCryq5fgiM2_LQ): The sauce was very flavorful/borderline salty, and the wings were on the boney side so there wasn't much meat on it. I wouldn't order this again.
-Grilled Pork Banh Mi w/Pate ($4+$??, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ty-sandwich-san-francisco?select=quPIOaOAlCryq5fgiM2_LQ#I9dHR2LrSOaClpf3y7HS4w): Yum! The grilled pork was done well, as were the pickled vegetables and the bread and mayo- highly recommended. However, the pate was just ok since it wasn't that flavorful- I like my pates very peppery, so I wouldn't add this again.

Overall, I really enjoyed my banh mi from here and will definitely be back to re-order the grilled pork and also try out the chicken and other fillings. Parking is super tough in this area, and there are very limited street parking spots, so try to come with another driver so that you can double park and jump in to grab your order quickly.
author: Amy D.

description: I live down street from this place and it was alway mentioned how good the sandwiches were here. All I can say is the lemongrass beef sandwich got so much flavor, bread just right, and the veggies are so tasty and fresh not to mention the Daikon and carrots with cucumber . I found my new spot for bang mi. So worth that 5.00 and great service with a smile. Thanks guys I be seeing you guys soon.
author: Miamia1954 R.

description: This place is great. Well deserving of the 4.5 stars. The meat in all the sandwiches I've tried here- hot and cold- is top notch. My usual go to's are the combo banh mi and the grilled pork. The baguette is warm and crispy and the shards of crust leave your mouth feeling destroyed the way a real banh mi should (get outta here with that soft roll, Dinosaurs). My only complaint about their sandwiches is that they only have sweet pickled carrots in them and no daikon. Man you gotta have the daikon! I'm missing that added crunch and peppery bite that they give and the carrots alone just don't cut it for me. Otherwise don't change a thing y'all. Anyway, until they add those pickled daikon 4 stars they shall remain.
author: William S.

description:
This place is definitely overrated. Based on the high number of 5 star ratings, I had high expectations. I ordered the lemongrass tofu sandwich. The baguette didn't have that crunch on the outside, softness on the inside I usually expect from banh mi's. The tofu was drenched in this super sweet sauce which made it super soggy and spongy. Maybe I came on an off day, but I would rate this place 2.5 stars if I could. Their prices aren't as cheap as others mentioned before. I paid $5 for a sandwich I could only eat halfway through. I much prefer Dinosaurs on Ocean (it's delicious and worth the $7). 

Pros are the restaurant had nice customer service, available indoor seating and it is relatively clean!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Great banh mi place in the Excelsior.  I live close by and now it's one of my regular go-to places when I need a quick lunch.  I even sometimes get one to go for later!  Their sandwiches are very great and I always call ahead and they have the sandwich ready to pickup.

Only downside is that area of Mission is super busy so not always easy to find parking if you're driving.  My favorite is the grilled pork.
author: John T.

description: Amazing sandwiches, very reasonable price.  All fresh ingredients, hard to beat for a quick delicious meal.
author: Katrina F.

description:
Ty Sandwich makes excellent bahn mi sandwiches. I came here on a Tuesday morning ~10am and there was no one here. I ordered a combination sandwich (#3) for $4.50 ($4.90 after tax) and the owner took about 5-7 minutes to make the sandwich. The sandwich was super satisfying, delicious, and toasted - They don't deseed the jalapenos so people who are sensitive to spicy foods may want to pull out one or two jalapenos before taking a bite (I found the spiciness to be a bonus!)

I can see what other yelpers mean by the service here is very nice. She smiles a lot, greets you, and thanks you for waiting when she gives your sandwich back to you. Overall, I feel pretty good about this place and would drive back (out of my way) to get a bahn mi sandwich. Next time, I'm going to order the grilled pork bahn mi and since a lot of people have been talking about it!

Overall, order the combination or grilled pork bahn mi sandwich ($4.90 after tax). Metered street parking right in front. Cash only. Take out recommended (seats only 8 people).
author: Nicole J.

description:
The Vietnamese coffee is very pricey.
I ordered Medium size of coffee and they charged me $5!
Even menu said $3.50 they charged me $5. 
Cashier said small is $4, Medium $5, Large $6.
But Thai ice is only $2.50. How coffee is two times expensive than Thai Ice tea?
And how upgrading size is $1! It's ridiculous.
Sandwich is only $5 and coffee is same as Sandwich price. 
Don't order coffee here it's same price with Sandwich.
author: Ashley R.

description: Been here over a dozen times. Always good. Mostly get the grilled pork sandwich. And inexpensive. Highly recommended.
author: Danny F.

description: I haven't really noticed too many banh mi shops in SF. Maybe I just haven't looked but I have a staple I go too by my work that I enjoy but I can't have it for dinner or during the weekend because I'm not trucking down to the FiDi if I don't have to be at work LOL. But anyway, I found this spot and it's actually way better and probably the best banh mi I've ever had. The sandwich is HUGE and the price is unbeatable. I just love the flavors and veggies that go into it. And this place is clean! Gotta love Ty's!
author: Dara S.

description: They are a true hidden gem of San Francisco food places. Their sandwiches are beautifully crafted and they have transcended into another level of sandwiches. It's a must check out place.
author: Jae K.

description:
Small shop! Quick and easy to order! Their menu basically consists of about 15 items. They have sandwiches, rice plate, and vermicelli, and a few appetizers like spring rolls and chicken wings. 

I ordered the Grilled Pork Sandwich and the Grilled Pork Rice Plate. Their grilled pork is absolutely phenomenal, as our most Vietnamese places. They just know how to grill their pork better than anyone else. I loved their rice plate too. It included a fried egg, two egg rolls, and a few strands of carrots. The egg was cooked perfectly; with the yolk oozing out onto the steamed rice, it tasted like heaven. 

My mom really enjoyed the sandwich. She loved the taste of it, even with the hint of spicy flavor from the jalapeño slices. I had to disagree. I don't like spicy but that's no big deal. I can always ask for no jalapeños next time. 

It doesn't take away from the fact that this little shop makes delicious food in only a matter of minutes. It's a must try again!
author: Regina L.

description:
I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich and milk tea with boba for my first visit. Everyone was really nice here. My total came to be $8.90 roughly. For SF, I guess these are standard sandwich prices. 

The sandwich was truly OK. A 3-star sandwich for my tastes because the chicken is marinated with fish sauce and lemongrass and cut into small chunks. For me, this made eating the sandwich a messy ordeal. It also had a strong fishy smell (I ate in my office) and I was not prepared for the smell or the strong salty lemongrass flavor.

The milk tea was overly sweet, even though I request half sugar. The bubbles were hard and chewy. 

So, a less than satisfactory experience. I would come back and try the combo sandwich or iced coffee but nothing else.
author: Carina L.

description:
I am SO glad they have an authentic Vietnamese sandwich shop in the Mission.

The place can easily missed since it has that small hole in the wall feel next to the Hawaiian BBQ place next door.

Let's start with the owner- they are a cute Asian couple, super sweet and approachable.  They're always so happy to see you and greet you warmly.

The food- I've tried almost all their banh mi (Vietnamese sandwich)- BBQ pork, BBQ chicken, tofu & meatball and I love them all.  Being a SJ native, I'm very picky about my banh mi and this place is right on.  The bread has the right crunch, and their meat or tofu is well marinated to perfection!

I have nothing but praises and love for this place.  Definitely a MUST try if you're in the Mission!
author: Katie N.

description: Delicious!  Have had their tofu sandwich, egg rolls, and the coffee!  Will continue to go back and try the different sandwiches!
author: Liz Z.

description:
I imagine the acronym of this tiny Vietnamese deli is the letters of the owner's name. 

Nevertheless, this tiny deli is indeed a welcoming addition to the Excelsior & outer-Mission area; an area that lacks any Vietnamese businesses. I don't expect the area to be the Tenderloin or the city of San Jose. Despite the propose conversion, the switch may never happen in our lifetime. But the transformation would be nice.

I was here twice within a week. My first visit was after eating my usual burrito from Taqueria Guadalajara, which is located directly across the street. I just had an Iced Vietnamese coffee for $3.00. The coffee was strong, creamy and adds a perk for my second-half of my working shift. My iced coffee from first visit: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ty-sandwich-san-francisco?select=8fDWv9_mLGi7w7yDGBI9UQ#9B8WM2eldNK4YrZ1ylN2Bw

As many of you have read from my "Quick Tip", the lady-owner was very nice on my first visit and persuades me to return. And that return was a week later in which I ordered the Combination Banh Mi and Thai Ice Tea for $7.00. All the ingredients are fresh and sliced thinly in a crunchy roll. The sandwich is one of the tastier ones in the city. My lunch from my second visit: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ty-sandwich-san-francisco?select=9B8WM2eldNK4YrZ1ylN2Bw#mAa3Ynx2lWJMbaNnxx_rng

This is not a big place and the small dining area is not a great place to mingle or listen to Katy Perry's "Dark Horse" on your device. 

For now, this cute little deli serves only sandwiches and a few appetizers. I hope the friendly owners will expand the menu and serve more items like rice plates or a comforting bowl of soup. But first, come here for the sandwich.
author: Matt G.

description: Love this place and have been coming here for years. One of the biggest things was I could feed my family for $20. Like all things in the bay though their prices have gone up. *sigh* still not crazy, but just means we go less.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Go here for a top-notch banh mi! The price is right and the sandwich was great. I ordered the grilled pork banh mi and it had the perfect french bread to accompany plenty of meat and carrots,onions, cilantro and jalapeños! I'll definitely be coming back for more!
author: Carey T.

description: I like this place its the only place in the area that gives you a good size banh mi and does a combination bahn mi right. All the different types of porks and lots of the condiments. My only gripe with them is that they use a microwave to heat up items before they serve them. I'm not sure if they only do this for to go orders or for just the chicken banh mi that I ordered. Either way, I will come back.
author: Jason S.

description: $5 for banh mi is on the pricey side, but have to admit that they don't skimp on the ingredients. Vietnamese coffee is also legit. Yum!
author: Priscilla T.

description:
It's official folks!  This is one of my goto "Banh Mi" places in the city!  $4? In the Mission? ...What? I know right?  It's crazy, but it's even crazier because it is delectably sooo good!  #3 COMBO is a must order!! It is made with Vietnamese sliced pork or pork bellies, pork sausage, brushed with butter & liver pâté with vegetables.  It is just fantastic!  My partner, from Saigon with a French palate said, "baby, get me more please...!" So ...I came back a few days later, and bought more to go!  Yup, it was that good, and my baby said, "You're the best hubby eva!"  Their #6 BBQ Grilled Pork is another that's going to make your mouth woootaaa!  

The husband and wife team who owns Ty Sandwich are just wonderful!  They are passionate, caring, and provided me with superior customer service!  This hole in the wall has only been opened a month or so and it's already "kickin ass!"  Perhaps, in just a matter of time, TY will KO every Banh Mi nearby!  So "betta" watch it... "There's a new Banh Mi in town" and it's called Ty!!

Cheers! :p
author: Edwin R.

description:
Decent banh mi in this neighborhood.

The owner was very kind, she seemed geniunely nice. We ordered one fancy pork and one bbq pork sandwich. You must get pate with the bbq pork!  Their bread is on the crispier side so if you get a cold sandwich you might want to ask them to not toast your bun.
author: Carmen A.

description: Even if you don't live near by, this place is worth the drive. The sandwiches are sooo delicious, always fresh, and the owners are so friendly. As a vegetarian I appreciate a good tofu sandwich and this is the place to get it. They finally accept credit cards now yay!!! Affordable too! Perfect little lunch spot.
author: Statler W.

description:
YES! Another great addition to the Excelsior. Two top favorite foods of mine all now close to my vicinity (BURRITOS AND VIET SANDWICHES BAY-BEEeeE!)

The ONLY gripe about this place is that it's cash only. Otherwise their banh mi freakin rocks (so much pate and filling :) + fresh bread!!!) and the people who work here are super sweet. Take my money!!

Call in early and order if you don't want to wait!
author: Emily C.

description: I have tried a dozen bahn mi places in San Francisco and Ty Sandwich is #2 on my favorites list!! I LOVE THIS place.  The lemongrass tofu was on their secret menu but I think they just added it on their menu board.
author: Jul C.

description:
Sandwiches is pretty good. I ordered #8 beef sandwich, the bread was really crunchy but not too hard, beef was good seasoned just a bit too salty for my taste and I forgot to ask for no onion (my bad). This shop is the best Vietnamese sandwiches I had so far in SF. 
CONS : parking is a bit challenging here.
author: Christine P.

description: The ham and pate sandwich was yummy and the guy that helped me was super nice.  I'm planning to go back and try more of their sandwiches on the menu.
author: Helen H.

description:
I stumbled upon Ty Sandwich through Yelp. Knowing that it is a new business, the reviews are high, and it is close to home, I had to try it out. I must say, Yelp never disappoints. 

Things I love about this place:
1) The simple menu
I am not overwhelmed by how many items are on the menu. I love the pictures. The pictures actually look like the food! (good job)
2) Location
I don't have to go all the way to the sunset to get a good vietnamese sandwich now! Yay me! There is also a small parking lot in back of burger king, right across the street. I know how excelsior district is, but thank god Ty Sandwich is across the street from a parking lot.
3) Customer Service
They were very friendly. Also, my order came out quick despite the other customers (probably 6 others ordering in the small shop) with me.
4) Their thai tea isn't fake!
Ty Sandwich actually uses real half & half and tea to make their thai tea! I witnessed it. Also, it was extremely addicting. I will come back for more.

There is only 1 table that seats 4 and a table top with 3 or 4 seats. It is probably best to order to go unless you're alone or with 1 other person.

My #3 combo vietnamese sandwich did not disappoint. There was plenty of pate (i love pate) and the bread was soft in the inside and crisp on the outside (not hard at all). They STUFF their sandwiches! In fact, I was full after eating only 1 half of my sandwich (that's how filling it was)

Overall, I really like this place. I'll definitely come back for more.
author: AJ C.

description: Good Banh Mi - love the chicken and tofu.  Then break is fresh and crunchy with a good portion of meats and vegetable.  This place is small and sitting is limited, however, the food is worth the wait.
author: Huy L.

description: Great food, great price! And it was quick! Came here hungry and not expecting much, I was very pleasantly surprised. We ordered a grilled pork and a chicken sandwich. Both were delicious with fresh warm bread, fresh carrots, jalapeños, cilantro and cucumber and a hearty portion of meat. All for 5 bucks(per sandwich)!
author: Joshua G.

description:
Hi Ty! I Love your sandwiches because they are crunchy and warm and so so tasty. And your Thai iced tea and spring rolls make me happy, too. 

When I'm in a hurry, I call in my order and run in to pick it up. The cashier is always super friendly and acts like she knows me. Maybe she does? 

When you're in the Excelsior and want a taqueria alternative, go to Ty for a banh mi.
author: Paula S.

description: the rose tea was very refreshing and just right (sweetness). i typically order the original vietnamese ham combo--preettyy good!!! spring rolls were also very good.
author: Marijoy A.

description: Solid bahn mi sandwiches, great bubble tea and also little spring rolls. Very fresh, flavorful and very inexpensively priced. Great bread that shatters when you bite in too.
author: David L.

description: This place is a gem. Fresh, inexpensive, filled with quality goodness. I've been passing this place up for a while going to Hawaiian drive in, but after my bahn mi cravings couldnt be filled (go-to place closed early) yelp recommended TY, I am so glad I went with it. Not only is it way closer than my used to be fav place, it's just as delicious if not more, & 1/2 the price! If youre looking for a good bahn mi, you've found it here ! Yes, just yes!
author: Louisa T.

description: Lemongrass tofu sandwich was delicious and flavorful. The pickled carrots, veggies were fresh and baguette was perfectly light and crispy. This is now my favorite Vietnamese sandwich spot in SF, possibly better than Saigon sandwich. The ice and milk tea options are fantastic.  Definitely worth trying if anywhere near area.
author: Teresa P.

description: I love this place,  the grille chicken sandwich is so good, the thai tea  is delicious , amazing customer service they always are smiling  thank you .
author: Criss P.

description: You can't beat this place.  The grilled pork bahn mi is bomb.  They include all the typical toppings, a generous amount of meat, and lots of sauce (sometimes too much).  But the best part is that the sandwiches are $6 - this is about as cheap as it gets for a quality sandwich in SF!
author: Riley D.

description: Good, fast, cheap. Not amazing but what I expected. Mayo needs some tang - squeeze of lime maybe??  Or veggies need more pickling.
author: Lizzie R.

description:
One of the best vietnamese sandwiches I've ever had!

I got the #6, grilled pork banh mi and the meat was flavorful and . Bread had a decent crunch and everything tasted pretty fresh! They definitely do not skimp on meat or veggies. 

They have friendly customer service and were pretty quick with my order. This sandwich spot is quite small and has about 2-3 tables for seating.
