This is probably the most I've ever paid for a banh mi, but I'd definitely return again!

TIP: CASH ONLY.
author: Eileen L.

description: I really like this place!!  Warning they are cash only unless you order online.  I definitely recommend the Grilled Pork Sandwich.  SOOO GOOOOD!  And also at a great price. :)
author: Desiree F.

description: Nice staff but thick cuts of meat were too fatty or difficult to chew. Can you please cut the meats thinner? Tasty pork marinade and fresh veggies. Nice staff.
author: Annie P.

description: This place has great banh mi! My favorites are the pork, lemongrass beef and (surprisingly) the tofu when I feel like going vegetarian. Their spring rolls are great too if you're feeling like you need a lighter meal. The egg rolls are a nice accompaniment as well. I just brought all my co-workers (15) lunch from here and they loved it! Don't forget to treat yourself with a boba, thai iced tea or Vietnamese Iced Coffee!
author: Julie D.

description:
Ty Sandwich came highly recommended. 
not surprised to find it a very small shop with only 7 banh mi offerings.

menu: rice plates, chicken wings, spring rolls, banh mi

eats: #2 ham & pate (4.25)
-lots of meat taste, fresh veggies and some spiciness
-crunchy bread, msg not tasted
-superior to most other banh mi tasted

crumbs: most banh mi offering were fried, or tofu.
-fast, friendly service
-little sitting inside.
-notice nearby vietnamese had banh mi for $4, didn't try
maybe a try of meatball next, but reviews mention little meat........
author: Victor G.

description: This place has really good sandwiches. I had the grilled pork and the combination and they were both delicious. Def my new go-to place for bahn mi. Ive heard the wings are also delicious. Also I think it's worth mentioning that the customer service is A-1. That's always a plus. Yelp let's you order for pick up which is great. Got there at the exact order time and my sandwiches were packed and ready to go. Can't wait to try the spring rolls!
author: Alex C.

description: Man, usually I would give a place like this 1 or 2 stars because I hate it when their prices go from $4 to $6 per sandwich. This is usually attributed to the hipster movement. (For the record, I don't hate hipsters. I just hate the fact that their numbers seem to explode like rats, making lines and prices higher.) However; this is run by some really great, hard-working people. I usually go BBQ pork sandwich but I've even been turned on to their combo and ham selections. I was always skeptical with the exotic flavors but I am now a believer. Great job.
author: Mike J.

description: Great sammich, awesome people. The owners run a nice shop with good food. Always friendly. Great experience.
author: Cheyenne B.

description:
I love banh mi xiu mai, so undoubtedly I had to try it. their banh mi xiu mai is pretty legit: soft, seasoned, and reminiscent of the homeland.

and the sauce they serve with in their banh mi is eggggcellent. nice touch.
author: Victoria N.

description: I've been going to place since it opened and it never disappoints me! The sweet lady who works the register recognizes my voice every time I call in, isn't that awesome? she gets most of my orders every time! As well as the other guy who wears a hat! They're all super friendly and nice. Their tofu banh mi is super flavorful and the bread is is super soft! That's when you know it's fresh. Their shrimp spring roll is pretty standard and fresh and I get this every time. They don't skimp out on the shrimp like other places do and the peanut sauce is flavorful. Give this place a go!
author: Robin M.

description:
I really need to look up from my phone more often because I pass by this place everyday on bus going home and I've never seen it!! 

Came here on a bright Thursday, 12pm no line. About 6 minutes wait for 2 warm sandwiches. Lady was very nice. Place had 1 table and a countertop with tall stools to sit on.

Ordered a #3 Combination $4, #6 Grilled Pork $4, and #12 Thai Tea. I am disappointed because I asked for jalapenos on the side(meant to save it for someone) and they put it IN my sandwich... Made the sandwich mildly spicy =(

Grilled pork was goood. The pork was tender. Reminds me of teriyaki. The meat looked DARK like it was burnt but there was no such taste. Bread was crunchy and the ingredients were fresh. What more can I ask for?

Thai Tea $2.75 was good in a decent sized cup.

Bought the Combination for someone else so IDK what it tastes like =( Looks really good though!

Good portions for the price. Will be coming back to try their Rolls =)
author: Benita M.

description:
I havn't had a Traditional Vietnamese Sandwhich like this since 1986 from  Kien Than in the Tenderloin.
They do Vietnamese Sandwhich right here at Ty.
Across from my favorite Burrito place Guadalahara. 
Friendly service.
Great Taste, traditional Crispy French bread.
Pate is what makes a Banh Mi legitly Viet. glad to tast it in it.
Highly recomend the Combination Pork and BBQ Sandwhiches.;)
-HUNG VAN LAM AKA hELLA HUNG 
Frisco 415 FLAVA KING
author: Hung L.

description:
Ty Sandwich is awesome! It's a short hop from Bernal and the food and service has always been stellar. I usually get either the combo or the grilled pork. All the other choices look great, but I'm stuck in a delicious rut.

It's the best bahn mi on this side of the city. A toasty crunchy roll with lovely flavorful fillings. It's hard to get the proper balance of outside crunch on the roll, yet with the bread still being soft. Ty Sandwich pleases in this regard.

Protip, if you call your order in, you can pick it up with no waiting.
author: Janet C.

description:
Ty keeps my wallet as full as my stomach with their cheap and filling sandwiches!

You can't go wrong with any of their bánh mì (Vietnamese sandwiches) as each one is made with quality ingredients. The baguette is light and crisp with a crunchy exterior. Shredded pickled carrots brighten the bánh mì with its tang and crunch. Cilantro sprigs add a taste of freshness while jalapeño slices lend a small kick. A swipe of mayo adds a subtle savoriness to an already rich medley of ingredients without being greasy.

Out of all the bánh mì fillings, my favorites are the grilled meats and tofu for their marinated flavors. The grilled pork and grilled chicken have a light chargrilled taste on top of already juicy meat. The tofu comes in thinly shredded slices that are dry, but the moisture from the pickled carrots and mayo balance it perfectly.

In addition to quality ingredients, well-balanced proportions are Ty's key to a stellar bánh mì. The most common shortcomings are too much bread or a smothering of mayonnaise, but you won't find that at Ty. They achieve a perfect balance between bread and filling, which is a generous amount enough to make the bánh mì feel stuffed. They also don't shy away from giving ample amounts of meat. You'll definitely end up feeling satisfied if not completely stuffed!

On top of all these qualities that make Ty's bánh mì great, perhaps the greatest is its price: about $4.00 with tax for each bánh mì.

If you're ever in the area, I'd highly recommend stopping by!
author: Tanya A.

description:
The best bahn mi sandwich I have ever had! To be honest, I haven't really tried many different places (probably 3 or 4 in my lifetime), but I don't think anything could ever top this place. 
The bread is so yummy. Flaky and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Just the right amount of chewy...Super friendly and fast service. I ordered the spring rolls (3) with my grilled pork sandwich, which together came out to $9-10 altogether. Love this place. I wish there was a 6 star option. Coming back this week to try the tofu sandwich
author: Reina R.

description: Amazing find on this little sandwich joint. Best Vietnamese sandwiches I've had in the city by far. Kind workers. Only sucky thing is this place is cash only :( regardless, it's still delicious.
author: Judy H.

description: My favorite local sandwich shop. Very affordable,very delicious, and the nicest people. Cash only, make sure you bring enough to tip. I recommend the lemongrass beef, but everything is delicious.
author: Julian S.

description:
So good, and folks here are super nice

Recommend
-the bread, so soft yet crunchy: the best
-grilled pork
-grilled chicken
-Vietnamese coffee (best all around if you're into chocolates flavors)
author: simon k.

description:
Hole-in-the-wall in the Excelsior district but Ty Sandwich knows how to do their bánh mì the proper way.  The baguette is awesome here and my jaw is not sore from eating their sandwiches. 

I would pick Ty Sandwich over a lot of Vietnamese sandwich places in the city... and that is saying a lot! 

Thai ice tea is done right here as well... recommend coming here to grab a bite that won't burn a hole in your wallet.
author: Sam K.

description:
It's been 2 months since I've first visited and I've come back each and every week.

I'm the type of person that sticks with what works, so I can only rate their grilled chicken sandwich. Their grilled chicken sandwich is like that $1 bag of hot cheetohs that I NEEDED to have every week back in the young simba days - tasty and bang for that $$$$. 

If a sub-$5 meaty flavorful sandwich appeals to you, then give them a call before you swing by and grab a bite of that hellyeahsss.

If you prefer a skinny viet sandwich better suited for my imaginary 5lb rodent sized chihuahua then go on witcho silly self cause this place aint for you. 

FIVE OUT OF FIVE.


Cash only. 

Don't have cash? Run to the nearby Safeway and buy the cheapest thing so you can get some cash back. I may or may not have done this before -____-
author: David Z.

description:
So mad I've never been here before. I'm now stopping in every time I'm in the neighborhood.

The #3 Combo Sandwich is the perfect classic and the #6 Grilled Pork is great.  The grilled pork has a "healthy" ;) amount of fat adding to the flavor.

Their sandwiches are better than what you'd find in the FiDi and almost up there with the TL.

Keep in mind they are cash only.
author: Zoran L.

description:
I keep going back here, and the great part is i only live a few blocks away :) 

love the BBQ pork and the chicken, perfectly seasoned and they are consistent with the seasoning. i actually like this place over dinosaurs on ocean. and the price range is about right for the quality. 

definitely recommend this place to everyone.
author: Toni Rose M.

description:
Dat bread though.

Dat bread at Ty's Sandwich be oh so carblicious. It be toasty and crunchy. It also be soft and fluffy. It be what making 'em banh mis at Ty Sandwich oh so dericious.

But dat bread though....

It be causing me dem cottage cheese thunder thighs. Dooooooooh Mahhhhh.

*Le sigh*

OTHER NOTES:
*Next door to Hawaiian Drive-In.
*Very friendly staff.
*Menu: Seven bahn mis available ($3.75-$4.25), Spring Rolls ($4.50), Chicken Wings ($5.75), and Rice Plate w/ one chicken wing, a fried egg & two egg rolls ($6.50).
*#7 Tofu bahn mi ($4.50) is similar to Dinosaurs but much healthier because they use very little mayo: http://bit.ly/1gBFhax. Tofu is fried shredded tofu and taro; not oily. Pickled veggies are uber fresh w/ a perfect tangy sourness. The toasted baguette is what makes this bahn mi solid.
*Wasn't a fan of the #3 Dac biet combo bahn mi. Meat filling was a bit scant and I barely tasted any pate even though we asked for extra: http://bit.ly/OpxSEr.
*Goi cuon spring rolls ($4.50) were tightly wrapped and very filling but accompanying peanut sauce was too salty and grainy (see link above for pic).
*The sauces they use do contain msg (i.e. Maggie sauce) so those with msg sensitivities beware.
*One table and several counter seats available.
*Semi-difficult street parking.
*Cash only.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Ordered grilled pork sandwich. I thought it was fairly bland. However, $5.99 (6.50 after tax) is too much for an average Vietnamese sandwich. The wow factor just wasn't there.
author: Yang F.

description:
I miss Westernize dishes. Banh Mi are one of my fav sandwiches of all time and when I recently went to Vietnam, I was shocked that they do not serve it in a similar manner. I now know that i dont care if its authentic or not - i just care which one taste better to me. 

Anywayz

Ty Sandwich is a great addition to the excelsior district. I dont know any good places in SF, besides down in south bay. I think this place is better than all the dinosaur places. This place be stackin' meat. Most places usually dont put enough, but here they pile it mile high. I ordered #6 which is the grilled pork for $4 - not bad considering its SF and they put a lot of meat. The meat is a little on the sweeter side compared to others, but that might be because there is a lot of meat. There is enough meat to take some out and make another one. Everything is pretty standard with the veggie, jalopeno and cilantro. Bread is served hot and fresh. Crispy and fluffy. ITS SO FLUFFY!!!!

They have been open for 2 months now, they know nothing about yelp. I told them how Important it is to maintain a good profile and they seem to be doing a great job so far. I will be coming back for some more sandwiches!
author: Ryan R.

description:
On our way to El Farolito, my Yelp assistant (aka my bf), noticed a small banh mi shop. We stopped to look at the menu posted and the pictures were enticing enough to make us change our mind. We both love banh mis and have never been here before, so we decided to give it a try. Inside the shop is really small. Theres a table of 4 and 4 stools against the window. 

Likes: the place is clean and the owners are nice. The items on the menu are all cheap. Everything is under $7. We got the combo and grilled pork banh-mi. I really liked the grilled pork. The bread was crunchy yet soft. They were very generous with the fillings. Fresh veggies,  plenty of jalapeno peppers (yesss!), not drenched  in sauce. The grilled pork was tender and loved the marinade. It was sweet but not overly sweet and was not hard to chew and most importantly, not fatty.  

Dislikes: parking can be challenging in this area but this won't hinder me from coming back. It's also cash only. 

This was a great find. Great food, great owners, great pricing. Will surely come back!

Price: 2 banh-mis, 1 viet coffee for $11
author: Cindy W.

description: Ty Sandwich really deserves 5 stars, I haven't had a bad experience once and they have the nicest staff/lady there. The sandwiches are good and have just enough in em and their Vietnamese coffee is just delicious. Will be back very soon!
author: Ryan L.

description:
I got a combination sandwich after work and boy it was so good! The bread was extra crispy and fresh, the veggies were sweet and sour, and the meat was excellent! However when I took my first bite I tasted jalapeños and spit it right back out. I wasn't aware they put jalapeños in their sandwiches. So if you're not in for spicy, you might want to ask them to leave the jalapeños out.

All in all I would totally come back and try out their other sandwiches. They also have Vietnamese desserts in a cup and a beverage fridge along with a rack of chips. ^^ also their daughter was so adorable and amusing to watch while waiting for my order. This seems like a family run business which keeps it so authentic. The couple that work here are very generous and all smiles when you walk in. So totally come check out this sandwich place if you're craving a sandwich, it's only $4 with great portions!
author: Shaina D.

description: Vest fresh viet sandwich I ever had, Good portions with lots of meat and crispy bread. I always get the bbq grilled pork it's soo good and the lemon grass beef is also good too. Parking is a hassle but I park in the safeway parking lot but it's worth the walk cause it's bomb sandwiches. I always go here wherever I crave a viet sandwich.
author: Tommy L.

description:
Love at first bite!

I just happened to be driving through the neighborhood and felt a craving for food. Saw this, and thought a bahn mi might hit the spot.

I ordered the grilled pork (#6) and some fresh spring rolls. Holy cow! & Wholly chao! That sandwich was freaking awesome from the first bite to the last. It's no wonder everyone else also gave this little hole in the wall five stars.

The staff was really nice and the prices are good but, that's not why I'm coming back. I'll be back for that delicious awesomeness of a bahn mi.
author: Paul D.

description:
I have been looking for good banh mi sandwiches in the Mission St. area and I found them!  I've been to this place several times and they've always provided good food at a good price.

Around $4.50 for the sandwiches and fresh spring rolls for $5.00.  My favorite so far is the Lemongrass beef sandwich with the right amount of lemongrass and beef in the sandwich.  The grilled chicken is my next favorite with tasty pieces of chicken that are not connected to cartilage.  The spring rolls are shrimp, shrimp & pork or shrimp & chicken.  They're all the same price and serving size (3 rolls). They offer a tofu one as well but I haven't tried it yet because I love my shrimp and meat ones too much.

The service is great as you are greeted by the friendly cashier/owner and thanked for waiting and coming to their establishment.  Some places don't do that anymore. 

Cash only and parking is on the street with meters or you can park a couple of blocks off Mission St. without meters.  It's worth finding the parking to try this place because your tummy will thank you after you;ve eaten.
author: Good D.

description: First impression sucked.. My combo sandwich, or at least what it was supposed to be, had like no meat in it.. && I've had my fair share of Vietnamese sandwiches, they're my favorite..! Maybe I'll give it another try, because I did like their Thai tea but that's it..
author: Rosie F.

description:
- amazing bread
- huge, overstuffed sandwiches
- yet perfectly balanced between meat, pickles and jalapenos
- $4.25-$4.50
- quality ingredients with authentic taste
- except for meatball whose tomatoey sauce adds delicious fusion flair
- possibly even better the next day!
- neighborhood/family feel, friendly workers (pretty much opposite demeanor of grouchy ladies at Saigon Sandwich)
- BEST BANH MI IN SF
author: Cecilia L.

description:
Woooohoo! As good as it gets! Place is small but very clean. The lady is welcoming wether on the phone or in person. My go to when I'm feeling crave for a banh mi sandwich. 
Pork with egg and ask to have it extra toasty yum yum :)

PS parking is terrible here but with the right luck you might just get one in front of the place. If not order ahead of time and just double park :)
author: Erika E.

description: Extremely solid banh mi here. Doesn't hurt that they're really nice and courteous. I go with the grilled pork and will be trying the spring rolls on my next trip there.
author: Warriors F.

description: Still the best grilled pork banh mi I've ever had and possibly the best in California.  Not even the restaurants get their pork this good!
author: Eric N.

description:
Friendly service, 
Strong Vietnamese coffee,
And tasty Banh Mi under $5,
Their rice plate is good too.
author: Icey M.

description: We found this place using yelp and I have so say it lived up to the five stars it had. We have the pork and chicken and they were truly wonderful. Staff we great. Not much else to say other than if you found this place you should eat here.
author: Steven H.

description:
Excellent quick banh mi.  I ordered #6 grilled pork with extra jalapenos.  I will order lemongrass beef next time!  

Bread was a touch dry but everything else was wonderful.  Pork had se nice gristlenon it that i love on a banh mi.  For $5, will definitely be back!
author: Jeremy B.

description:
Got my sandwiches and bread was too toasted on all of them. So bread was falling apart as we were eating!
It really distracted from the filling of the sandwich.
author: Jane N.

description: Good flavor in the meat and all around taste. Tofu was ok, and beef and pork were yummy. Bought togo and ate at home. 2nd time and will keep coming back for more.
author: ben c.

description: My girlfriend and I go to Ty Sandwich almost every week(sometimes every other day) for these delicious vietnamese sandwiches.  A very underrated and small shop with simple flavors to satisfy your vietnamese sandwich needs.  Very nice people working there, can call in for pick up if you are in a rush!  Small selective menu from a few sandwiches to rice plates and spring rolls.  Definitely the best vietnamese sandwich spot in SF so far!
author: Jechelle T.

description: Tried it for take-out while we were in the area and it did not disappoint. The only thing to keep in mind is it is a "cash only" business.
author: David B.

description:
Good sandwich and wait time.
Saturday 1:30, ordered and received in less than 10 minutes. I ordered grilled chicken for $4.90 including tax. The sandwich is about 7 inches long. Too many carrots though.
author: M P.

description:
In short, pretty delishious Banh mi sandwiches. They're missing the white, stringy vegetable (I have yet to find out what those are called so please feel free to enlighten me), which makes me slightly sad, and I'm not a huge fan of the mayo sauce they use or how the grilled chicken is seasoned (those are things that could be improved...hint hint), but I like the bread, and the carrots, and cucumber, and jalapeño. Oh, and they were out of those fresh spring rolls! How can you run out of something on the menu?! I'll be back...

P.S. The person who said this place is better than Dinosaurs is TRIPPIN.
author: Kathryn S.

description: What a gem! Definitely coming back here to try other things. The lemongrass banh mi was so good!! Peanut sauce for the spring roll was very peanut-y. Also very good at a reasonable price.
author: Binh H.

description: Loove their grilled pork banh mi, normally ill order the combination else where, first time here and i thought hrm, never had a grilled pork banh mi before, so why not. they don't skimp out on the meat, the meat is not dried, its nice and juicy, very flavorful. parking is a hassle cause its street parking but i was able to find a parking right in front . i will definitely come back (=
author: Siling C.

description: Fantastic.  Fresh.  Authentic.  Clean.  No Frills.  Sandwiches have a good ratio of meat to veggies and spring rolls were moist and extremely fresh.  I had the combo sandwich and the meat with perfectly, thinly sliced.  I try Banh Mi sandwiches where ever / whenever possible.  This is the real deal.  And refreshing to be in SF and be able to pay $5 for a sandwich.  YUM.
author: Beautiful B.

description: Best deal in town! Great sandwiches and quick and friendly service. Love this place! We usually get the pork or chicken or lemongrass tofu sandwiches. Good sized portions and fresh tasty ingredients.
author: Sinee H.

description: My go-to Viet coffee, spring roll, AND sandwich place! The owners are super friendly and welcoming as well!
author: Shusi K.

description:
I'm soooo glad I found this place! I've passed by this place so many times for burritos, and never noticed it! 
I ordered a grilled bbq banh mi online today, and when I got there it was still warm. The bread was perfect, crispy on the outside, and soft on the inside. They're very generous with their meat, which is a plusssss! This place is officially my favorite spot for banh mi now. 
The guy cooking the food and the lady at the counter were so nice and welcoming.
I'm going to throw this place into my weekly rotation for food lol, yes, I loved it that much.
author: Pauline E.

description: I had my first bahn mi about a year ago while bike riding thru the streets of San Francisco . Ever since i have been crazy about them and venturing to different places on the search for the ultimate bahn mi. I want to say ive been to just about every place in SF that you can get a bahn mi but that might be a bit of a stretch, either way I definitely feel i qualify as a bahn mi expert and in all my months of searching, there has always been that 1 bahn mi that shines brighter than all the others and that my friends is from Ty Sandwich! perfect everytime in everyway! from service to quality this is the ultimate place to get your bahn mi fix.  perfect addition to an already great little joint.  Go out of your way for this place trust me you wont regret it!
author: Israel M.

description: Got the yummo combination sandwich. Bread is lightly toasted. Meat tasted super fresh. Daikon and carrots are perfectly pickled. Pate was on spot. Vietnamese coffee strong and sweet. All for $8. I asked for extra jalapeños and the lady kindly gave it to me with a smile . Way cheaper and better than dinosaurs sandwiches. Rawr!
author: Cathy P.

description: Best place in the world. Happiness happens here. Sandwiches are bomb. Thai tea is bomb. Guy grilling pork in the back is bomb. Guy taking my order knowing I always get a Thai tea with my pork sandwich is bomb. Fried egg rolls my girlfriend always get are bomb. This place is bomb
author: Claudia M.

description:
One of the better spots in San Francisco to get banh mi! The space itself is small although the there is a little bar area & some stools to sit on.
I've been here several times and I always get the roasted pork sandwich. Just the right amount of saltiness to the pork, the pickled veggies always taste fresh, and the pate spread is so good. Unlike most places that serve thai tea, their tea was sweet enough and you could still taste the tea. Their spring rolls are also decent and wrapped up nicely with a container of peanut sauce where you can take it to go easily. Prices are very decent and don't break the bank.
Service is always friendly and the employees are always willing to make suggestions of you don't know what you want. 

Tips: Cash only. Parking is a bit tricky as well since its on Mission street & everything is metered.
author: Elaine T.

description:
I had a roast pork sandwich it was delicious. Plenty of pork the bun was just the right softness with a crisp crust. They were out of the spring rolls and the meatball sandwich, the only two things my partner wanted to eat, he went next store to the Hawaiian food restaurant. Only reason I didn't give five stars. 
Our Chow Chow watched us eat...
author: Mike K.

description: They have remodeled a lot and made it more welcoming and friendly. And taken notice to a lot of smaller details that customers will notice.
author: Kyle R.

description: The sandwich is pretty good!  But, they've raised the prices.  So the allure of a cheap banh mi for lunch has turned into a decent sandwich just convenient if I'm in the area.
author: Josh K.

description:
Whoot Whoot Raise the roof!!  

Cool little spot in the Excelsior, right next to Hawaiian Drive In.  Nice simple menu.  Sometimes its better to have limited items on your menu as long as you are are consistent with the food.  

I ordered The Combination (#3), The Grilled Pork (#6), The Combination Spring Rolls and an Thai Iced Tea.  

ALL DELISH!  I can't say anything negative about any of the items I ordered.  The husband/wife team are super friendly and personable.  Bang for your buck sandwiches, worth every every cent.  Sandwiches are full, not at all skimpy.  I liked the Combo Spring Rolls, gave you 3 different options; one shrimp only, one shrimp/grilled pork, one shrimp/grilled chicken.  The peanut sauce was a little on the spicy side but it was delish nonetheless.  Will definitely become a regular here.
author: Sarah N.

description:
Yes, Mission Noodle House is a few doors down, and yes, Ty Sandwich focuses mainly on banh mi.  But the thing about focusing on less rather than more is what works for Ty Sandwich, where wait times are minimal, service is friendly and personal  (they remembered me from my last visit 2 weeks before!), and, most importantly, the sandwiches are consistently well-crafted and delicious. 

Banh mi don't need to be busy or have any bells and whistles; the bread just needs to be fresh and warm with a crisp crust and a tender yet substantial crumb, the vegetables perfectly pickled and tender-crisp, and the charcuterie flavorful without being obnoxious or overly seasoned. They should be humble. They don't need to brag about being organic or lactose- or MSG- or anything-else-free or brag about having meats from Niman Ranch or Marin Sun Farms or any other fancy meat purveyor du jour. The sandwiches just need to be consistently well-crafted and delicious. 
And as I mentioned before, here at Ty Sandwich, they are! 

The place is cozy, clean, and inviting. The prices are spot-on (sorry, folks...anyone paying much more than $4 and change for banh mi is a complete fool trying to eat at a place that shouldn't have banh mi on its menu), and Lin and Edison are just about the nicest people you could possibly meet.

If you like your sandwich on the spicy side, make sure to ask for more jalapeños. Also, be aware that they have other stuff that isn't on the menu, so don't be scared to chat Lin and Edison up and check out more of their tasty goods (like the spring rolls, which are available fresh or deep-fried and served with the usual nuoc cham OR their other sour/spicy sauce, the name of which I can't remember)!

(And no, I didn't know Lin and Edison from before I tried their food, so this isn't one of THOSE reviews, okerrrrr?!? #justanhonestopinionfromthehood)
author: Ricky C.

description: Sandwiches are great! They even make Thai iced tea and boba and the owners are so friendly.
author: Emm B.

description:
Soooo fantastic!  First time visit and so wow'd! The place is unassuming and the food quality is not only above expectations but beyond what you'd expect given the prices, neighborhood, and ambiance.  I was greatly surprised and will be returning as a regular given the location.  Finally, some high quality, delicious vietnamese food in the nieghborhood! Yay!
Two thumbs up to for the spring rolls, chicken and pork sandwiches and fried chicken.  Yummm--eeee!!!!!
author: Jez S.

description: I ate at this place a lot when I lived in the Excelsior. Kind of the only recognizable food in the neighborhood besides Pizza Hut and a really, really good Thai place. I loved the tofu banh mi and was kindaddicted to the shredded lemongrass tofu, which they didn't always have. The people here were friendly, so I was really surprised when one day I ordered a sandwich on eat24 on my commute home from Oakland and realized I wouldn't be back in excelsior to pick the sandwich up before the place closed. I called them to tell them I would be late, and the girl was super rude about it and told me she was going to charge me anyway and throw away the sandwich. I stopped eating there after that.
author: Elaina P.

description: Came here to grab a quick bite to eat before watching a volleyball match. I really wanted pineapples which is around the same area, but they were closed. Decided to stop by and order a sandwich because I need something quick. Unfortunately it took longer than I would have liked. I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich and I felt like I was waiting there for a while. I think there were only 2 parties ahead of me, but for some reason they were taking there time. When I finally got my sandwich it was just meh. Nothing special. My favorite Vietnamese sandwich shop is on Irving, but if you're looking for something in the area it's not bad
author: Kelly S.

description: I've been getting the combination sandwich from here for awhile, and it's been very hit-or-miss; sometimes they'll be great right after purchase, and other times they'll require a little toasting to soften the bread
author: Raymond G.

description: Excellent deal, delicious sandwiches and friendly service. One of the best places on this stretch of Mission Street.
author: T-Bone L.

description:
I'm from Houston (and Vietnamese) and I loveeeee Givral/Don's Vietnamese Sandwiches. In the Bay Area- this is as close as you can get to that flavor of Viet Sandwiches.

The bread is perfect- crisp and not too chewy that it cuts the roof of your mouth. The mayo is legit and I really liked the BBQ pork (bánh mì tht nng). I feel like it's missing the delicious dash of Maggi seasoning sauce but otherwise pretty darn good! I would def recommend their $4.75 sandwich. 

The spring rolls are expensive $5 and just ok tasting. I've never had gi cun with BBQ pork so I think it was a little too much for me. I prefer the simple spring rolls. But still good!
author: J D.

description:
Feigning for Banh Mi at 730pm, we discovered Ty Sandwiches from my trusty Yelp app while in the excelsior district. It's a tiny storefront cluttered alongside taquerias on a busy intersection of Mission st.

The entire store seats a total of 8 people, 4 at the bar window and 4 at a table. Walk in and you will find a display of chips and bottled drinks. On the menu, shown on a poster board above the register, they keep it simple with a total of 12 menu options: 7 sandwiches ($3.75-$4), chicken wings, rice plate, spring rolls and iced coffee or thai iced tea.

It was hard to decide which option to pick, as they all looked good.  We finally decided on 3 sandwiches: Combination, Meat Ball, and Grilled Pork.  I added extra pate to all of them because I LOVE pate. The sandwiches came out piping hot and you could tell the baguette was freshly baked by how fluffy the bread was and how crispy the crust was.  Inside each sandwich was the typical offerings of mayo, jalapeno, pickled carrots/daikon, and cilantro.  My ultimate favorite was the grilled pork, the char flavor on the pork was so delicious.  I also ordered a thai tea ($3), which was delicious.

What a great place to go for banh mi and milk tea! The lady at the front called me sweetie, so she'd already sold me there.  The other guy working there was just as pleasant even though they were already cleaning up to close when we walked in.  I'll be back!
author: Michelle W.

description:
I had to call for delivery since Yelp said it doesn't deliver to my address. The lady said 20 mins but it took about ~40 mins and I only live 7mins away. 

I usually go to Mission Noodle Cafe but decided to try this place out. I must say, the sandwiches here are pretty darn good. The combination was really good and the BBQ pork was really flavorful. 

I'm deducting a star because I ordered a tofu roll and it didn't have tofu... Does that make sense?! The sauce that came with it was good though.
author: Cheryl P.

description:
I got the bbq chicken really really good, my mom was complaining that it was taking a while but then i saw thats its made fresh to order.

thai tea is bomb.com

shrimp spring rolls ehh 2 stars for that i love the peanut dipping sauce, the roll need more flavor, maybe if i had chili sauce it woulda tasted better

cash only... 
bring quarters for parking

ohh yea i also like it because it was very sanitary!! i will be back
author: Erica S.

description: So good! Fast service & my favorite is combination banh mi with extra pate (+ $0.50)! The bread here is perfection - crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. Not as cheap as San Jose, but for under $5, you will get authentic banh mi with all the fixings!
author: J C.

description: This place is delicious.  Had a lemon beef sandwich and grilled chicken sandwich.  Along with a boba tea. Very fresh and hot. I will definitely be back.
author: Lawrence C.

description:
I work down the street from this place. Ever since they opened, I probably come here atleast once a week. The have great prices on their sandwiches. I think all of them is under $5. How can you resist that? But, its not only the price that makes me come here that often, its the sandwich. The quality of the food alone makes me give them 5 stars. Their pork bbq banh mi is my favorite. Try to pair that with their chicken wings, boom. Perfect lunch combo! 

Another thing that makes me rate them 5 stars is the customer service. This place is owned by a middle aged Vietnamese couple. They are both really nice! 

If ever you're around the area and craving for some Banh Mi, do not hesitate to try TY Sandwiches. It definitely worth a shot!
author: Mike M.

description:
I had the #3 Combination sandwich and liked it!  It wasn't amazing, but it was good, especially for the price.  The cashier was really nice and friendly as well.  The sandwich did take a while to make (hence the -.5 stars) but with good food, good prices, and good service, can't ask much more from a Vietnamese sandwich shop.

I'm looking forward to going back to try the other sandwiches, egg rolls, and chicken wings!

FYI, they sell their bread as well, its 75 cents per roll/loaf.
author: My N.

description: Food is fresh, tasty, and price is decent.  Sometimes wait is long and not much seating.  Metered parking nearby.
author: Simon L.

description:
Diamond in the rough.

Was really skeptical about Ty's, BUT! Turns out they make their tofu sandwiches with shredded tofu to give the feel of shredded pork! The carrots were so so fresh and savory. There isn't a lot of room to sit comfortably but, if you're trying to pick up a quick dinner and put on Netflix, it'll be wonderful date for 1 or 2. I will definitely be back!
author: Diane A.

description: Have been craving vietnamese sandwiches for the longest time and saw great reviews for this place and definitely wanted to check it out since it is so close to my house. Parking can be hard to find here since it is on Mission but transportation is very convenient (14 or 49 for muni). If you must drive, I would recommend parking on Alemany or the smaller streets. It is a very cute and simple restaurant that is greeted by a very friendly staff! The sandwiches are about 4.25-4.50 which are not bad actually considering places like Dinosaurs is close to $7! We ordered the grilled chicken, tofu, and lemongrass beef. I thoroughly enjoyed the chicken and tofu but was disappointed with the lemongrass beef. I was expecting slides of beef flavored with lemongrass, and while the lemongrass flavor was good, the beef was shaped as a meatball and the meat felt "mushy," which is a texture I did not like. I would definitely come back to try the other flavors but would stay clear of the lemongrass beef just because it is made in a texture I am not used to in my vietnamese sandwiches.
author: Wendy Z.

description: I thought Saigon sandwich was the best, but no, I was wrong. this place has the best Viet Sandwiches I've ever had. Cheap and delicious. whenever I am in that side of the city I get the lemongrass and the grilled pork sandwiches - simply delicious. I wish it was closer to where Iive.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
Must go. Awesome people with awesome food.  There 2 days in a row.  1st day, I ordered one of each, perfect food for park playdate food for moms. Have to say the combo is my favorite.  2nd day, heading to Gilroy Gardens with son and mom.  Again, great road trip food.  Yummy but flaky.  Let's talk about flaky, the bread is so good, normally I get all my sandwiches and bagels hollowed out in my poor attempt to eat less carbs.  I forget for these sandwiches but the flesh of the bread is so soft, after the pate, meat, and veggies gets piled in, the sandwich is the prefect vessel for all the goodies.  It didn't even hurt the roof of my mouth like most banhmi does.  Good crunch!

Besides the good sandwiches, the service won me over.  The first day, I really wanted the fresh spring rolls because I saw the pictures on Yelp and my son loves them.  I was too early for them, they lady got on the phone to do her best speaking in Cantonese on her best attempt to get them for me.  She was doing it not knowing I could understand her.  Good effort, love that.  2nd day, I ran out of cash and was 2 bucks short, without hesitation, she says "No worries, next time."  Who does that?  Of course, I went back to the car and got more cash and paid up.  But the gesture and trust was appreciated and seldom do we experience that anymore.

Kudos for Asian Small Business and great service!!
author: germaine n.

description:
Tie one on.

In a bad way: http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=tie%20one%20on

In a good way: $4 and change for a packed grilled chicken banh mi. Mayo and jalapeños were left out as requested. Flavor was left in.

Only wish there was hoisin sauce to make a sweet deal even sweeter. Friendly service from the staff more than made up for it.

Great spot to go on a lunch bender.
author: Jason B.

description:
Great sandwich. Absolutely love the grilled pork + pate (for an extra $0.50). I think the price for the sandwich, $4.50, is definitely worth the trek over to the excelsior. Also, the lady at the register is so sweet! She calls her customers sweetheart - it's wonderfully welcoming.

The spring rolls, also around $4.50, were not the best spring rolls I've had. They were lacking something and the peanut sauce was nothing to rave about either. The sandwich was the star and the main point of my going there, so I still give this place a solid 4.

Next time I will definitely ask for extra jalapenos since I like my bahn mi a bit spicy.

Don't forget- cash only!
author: Junel S.

description: I come here at LEAST once a week. The owners are the nicest people in the world. And the food is amazing. Especially the lemon grass tofu sandwiches (highly recommended). 10/10
author: Brett S.

description:
I'm going to be honest....this review will not justify the awesome sandwiches and plates this place has to offer! You will just have to try it for yourself.....The vietnamese sandwiches are the best I've had and the couple who owns the restaurant and serves these are even more awesome. 

My family's go-to sandwich is the grilled pork. Their meat is quality....none of that fatty gristle like other places. Plus, they give you a nice amount with a good amount of all the fixings. I get mine with extra jalapeño! Yumm! 

Their grilled pork rice plate is also delicious and comes with 2 small imperial rolls and an egg. 

Sandwiches are $4 and rice plates are $6! Affordable and quality food is what I like! I'm so glad they are close to the neighborhood I grew up in.....welcome to the Excelsior District TY Sandwich!!!
author: La C.

description:
I just tried the sandwiches here yesterday and I had to come back today to grab one for my mom to try it! My whole family loves the sandwiches here already.

I've had the combo and I can already say that I'm sure the rest are yummy as well. There are only two people who work there but it looks like they've got everything down. The lady who makes the sandwiches is very nice and attentive to what you want.

This is DEFINITELY my new place to grab some viet sandwiches!!!
author: Rowanne M.

description: Good, cheap, quick.  Had the grilled chicken sandwich and fresh shrimp rolls.
author: Scott V.

description:
What happened? Came back to grab a combo Bahn mi Sammy and all I got was super toasted Bahn mi. Crumbs everywhere-around my mouth,shirt,and jeans. Ugh. 

Overly toasted bread is not the business yall.
author: Cee M.

description: I eat here all the time but today I picked up sandwiches that were cold. Tasted like they left it in the fridge from earlier in the day... really disappointed
author: James S.

description:
Absolutely delicious.  I'm not a fan of cilantro and I'm only a minor fan of Vietnamese sandwiches.  I had the grilled pork and it blew me away on many levels.

1. The meat had an amazing flavor and with rice, could have easily been a dish by itself.
2. Somehow, someway I found myself even eating the cilantro.
3. The flavors worked extremely well and were really balanced.
4. The sandwich was beyond cheap.  I've paid twice as much for food half as good at other places.

After the sandwich, I ordered an iced Thai tea.  Again, I was blown away.  The people were friendly too.
author: Mike C.

description:
all I can say is best Vietnamese sandwich I ever have! 

only $4.50 for this deliciously balanced sandwich and $5. for shrimp spring rolls  today the sauce seems to be just made and oh my! Ty never disappoints
author: Sara P.

description:
YESSSSS I LOVE DELICIOUS 5 STAR WORTHY FOOD NEAR HOME. 

Found this place after browsing through yelp and still maintained a 5 star rating after 50+ reviews so of course I have to try it, especially since it's so close to my house. 

I ordered the grilled pork and I'm completely obsessed with it. It was so flavorful and juicy and the bun was amazingly crispy. I devoured it in mere minutes. And it went great with my thai iced tea. 

This will definitely be a usual spot for me from now on.
author: Harriet W.

description: Very solid bahn mi.  The people are friendly and efficient.  Price is reasonable and ingredients are fresh.  I would give 5 stars, but the area is a little suspect.
author: somel y.

description:
I'm writing this review while eating my Meatball Sandwich from this place--so it's a huge deal because the last thing you want to do while eating is typing something.

I want to give a huge recognition for this place, for their quality of food and service. I had spotted this place for a while whenever I go to Safeway. One day, my brother and I decided to try this place out. I ordered the combo sandwich and my brother got the grilled pork. We also shared the spring rolls. One thing that was very obvious from the food is they're all fresh. The thing about Vietnamese sandwiches is, the pickled veggies turn colors when they're not as fresh (you know what I'm talking about?) You won't experience this at this place. Every elements of the sandwiches is great (though, I guess they could use a teensy bit less jalapeno, but that's personal).

The people who work here are extremely friendly too. I'm definitely coming back to this place a lot more times in future!
author: Harry G.

description: I love this spot . I come for the meatball bahn mi all the time . super friendly staff .. and always get my order right !
author: Micah W.

description: Hands down the best Vietnamese sandwich I've had in a while! I loved the pork sandwich and the owner was so nice to us! Definitely coming back!
author: Revan N.

description:
So I just finished eating my tofu sandwich.  I just finished drinking my Vietnamese coffee.  I recently had the misfortune of eating the blandest bahn mi I've ever had, and the one before that gave me a stomach ache, so I am very happy to report that this sandwich has restored my faith in the entire genre of bahn mi.
The veggies were exactly what I wanted; crisp, fresh, perfect but subtle balance between sweet and sour, neither overpowering the other.  The bread was crispy, crunch, but didn't cut my mouth up when I bit in. The tofu had a really nice flavor that just blended everything together into one happy sandwich. 
Also, I don't really like coffee, but this was goooooood.

Truth be told I try to rate based on overall experience, but service alone gets 5 stars. So I had to put my phone down and wait to get my bahn mi before going any further. Gosh they are so nice there. She was out of change and made me feel good about giving her a bunch of coins! I will definitely be back on days when I just need a sandwich.
author: Astrid V.

description: Tasty bahn mi!  I ordered the grilled pork and the sandwich was filled with meat.  Great value for $4.50.  If you don't like spicy, make sure you order your bahn mi without jalapeño.  They ones they used definitely had a kick.
author: Christina N.

description:
Good Vietnamese Sandwiches (a lot of options)
Not good shrimp fresh rolls - small so wrapper stuffed inside forming mound of wrapper
author: Charles K.

description: This is def. a hidden gem!!! It's so good that I almost regret finding this place because I know I will be tempted to go here everyday after I run!! Personally, I love Love LOVE Vietnamese sandwiches and I'm always searching for the perfect ONE! I've tried a bunch of them and this is honestly comparable to Saigon Sandwiches in the TL. I ordered the grilled chicken w/o mayo and my boo thang got the lemongrass grilled beef( it's not on the menu, but the lady told us to try it). Both sandwiches came out hot and toasty and the bread was crunchy and amazing. The sandwiches were both stuffed with tender juicy meat and a very generous heap of veggies! It def. satisfied my bahn mi craving! With that being said, I will be back for more yumminess!!!!
author: Celina C.

description: Its hard to find a decent banh mi in San Francisco. I had high hopes for this place from the reviews, but as in most places in the bay area, there was always something wrong with the sandwich. For me, most everything was spot on - crispy crunchy chewy bread with lots of pate and pickled veggies. Where they went wrong was super cold slices of meat inside. The combo banh mi should be served with room temp slices of meat rather than straight from the fridge slices. Otherwise this place is decent in a pinch.
author: Henry W.

description: These sandwiches are so good and reasonably priced. Right down the street and I go here a lot. They're very quick and placing a pick up order was easy.
author: Xavier T.

description:
Overall: Yummy Vietnamese food

Pros
- chicken banh mi 
- spring rolls
- chicken wings

Cons
- pork banh mi is just ok

Sidenote
- they use real French bread
- sauce with the spring rolls is delicious
author: Michelle D.

description:
Yummy! We had the ham and pate sammie and the grilled pork sammie. The bread was crisp on the outside and fluffy on the inside. The amount of meats and veggies was perfect. The grilled pork was nicely seasoned and not fatty or chewy. 

We also ordered the spring rolls -- tasty but the dipping sauce was too salty. I wouldn't get them again but I will definitely be back for the sammies. 

We also tried the Vietnamese coffee and the Thai iced tea. Nice but again, I'd just come back for the sammies. 

And the two people working were really nice and sweet!
author: K. S.

description: If you're looking to satisfy your taste buds with some of the most amazing sandwiches you can find in the city, then this is the right place! With a small place and only a few seats, this isn't a huge establishment but it compensates for the space with amazing flavors and prices that will have you coming back!
author: Jose G.

description:
15.11.07.  One of few revisits ... 
     I would drop by more often ...
     If I didn't lived across the town

I have just boosted the rating
 Food ...................................... 4 - 4 1/2

9 in wide bun ... details further down
Generous in meat and fillings
Vinegar mixture is appealing
   So places .. too sweet, sour, weak
As more places offer Banh Mi
The more I respect this place sandwich.
The balance in flavors

------------------------------
14.03    March 2014        First Visit     Accidentally run in

Food .......................................  3 1/2 - 4
Place ......................................  Simple counter at the window
Cleaniness .............................  New place ... spotless for now
Service ....................................  3 1/2 - 4


New place ... less than 3 months old ... can't get any cleaner than this.
 
Super friendly lady and funny bored daughter (kid) fidgeting ... keeps u entertained while waiting ... hey I believe make the best out of everything ... less stressful way.

BBQ Pork
      - Original banh mi bun ... very crispy and soft inside
               + some places uses a diffrerent version ... not the same bite and 
                                 mouth feel (is there such term? ... hard to explain)
      - Super generous on the pork like I ever seen.
               + The meat was heavily marinaded so it was a little saltier 
                           and stronger in taste ...
                           not a problem ... I will ask her less meat 
                                       (yes ... first time I ever requested less meat!)
                            yes, it was that much that I could make another sandwich!
                            Who knows ... it may have been a fluke .... 
                                       will  drop by again to find out
       - Nice grilled taste
                + some places the meat tasted more sauteed than grilled
                            not here
       - The pickled veggie strike a good balance 
                       with strong flavors coming from the meat
                + for my case less meat and a little more veggie
       - Good chunky pate spread ... I liked it ... it seems better than other ones
                        (maybe its me ... first try ... will get back to this after next visit)

Being a new place, it is naturally:
       - a little slow in finishing the order
                   from what I saw ... she puts a lots of attention and
                           effort puttting it together (no ... I was not starring like a maniac)
                              the two sandwiches contents were perfectly spread 
                                        not haphazardly ... yes ... I do like to observe things ... 
                                        always learn things ... its fun
        - There were several orders ahead of me 
                    so it is not fair to gage her speed
        - As time passes ... 
                  she will be more efficient
                  change the layout of the prep area for better execution
                  and etc
                  Hey, for new places and/or new staff ... it is a matter of practice
                           Come on people ... when u do new things or task 
                                         ... don't u fumble time to time
                           As time progresses you do improve and evolve ... well I hope so
                  I always give newbies another visit under a half year latter 
                        ... sometimes they evolve into something that 
                                   I am been glad to dropped by again

This place ... I will drop by sooner ... worth the travel cross town for 
      balance:   price, taste, effort, service, and etc ... this is one of places
      I love see it succeed ... because it deserve it ... just try it ... I just wish
      it was near my home or workplace. One of the better Banh Mi sandwiches.
      I will ask her less meat and more pickled veggie ... for my taste ... even my 
      friends were impressed by the generousity of the meat (A fluke ... who know?)


Can't wait to try the other items
Will revisit soon and update this review
author: S.K. Y.

description:
Very good vietnamese sandwich served fast.  I usually pay $3.50 for one of these, but they're $4 here.  Excellent tradeoff considering that they give you a healthy amount of meat, and it was tasty and well marinated with no gristle!  I think you also get some bonus vegetables here too--some cucumber and onion.

I'll be a regular here.
author: Rocco B.

description:
Ordered the Combination and Grilled Pork Sandwich and they were both BOMB!!! Also had the spring rolls which were not bad but I enjoyed their Ice Coffee the most. It is kind of sweet for my liking but the flavor was still really refreshing. Everything was freshly made on order! For this price and quality, I would say this is one of the best places to get Banh Mi from in SF. 

Side Note:
You know how sometimes when you eat Banh Mi, the top of your mouth gets cuts and stuff from how hard the bread is. Well this place's bread is crunchy and it does not hurt your mouth at all!
author: Billy M.

description:
One of my favorite banh mi places in all of SF and San Jose. 

The grilled pork actually tasted freshly barbecued and the combination sandwich had the perfect amount of pate. Both sandwiches were filled to the brim and had flavor in every bite. 

I was shocked that they were only $4 each. That is pretty much the standard price in SJ and banh mi is usually a buck or two more in the city. 

Our food took about 10 or 15 minutes to be prepared but it was well worth the wait.
author: Diana N.

description: I really wanted to like this place, it's super hole in the wall and i had really high hopes based on the yelp reviews, but their veggie options were kinda lacking. They have two different tofu options: shredded and lemongrass. The shredded is a little dry, but similar to the shredded sandwiches I've gotten at other places. The lemongrass could be really good, the flavor was awesome but it was incredibly tough to eat. My jaw hurt from trying to chew it, and add the dryness in to and it was a poor performance. But i would definitely come back if this place fixes their tofu, because the actual lemongrass flavor was awesome.
author: Amaresh S.

description: Very solid banh mi. I don't think they pickle their veges. I might be wrong. Super cheap. I rather eat two of these than one roxie's.
author: Jeff L.

description: I do like the stuffing of the sandwich, so much carrots, the right consistency.  The chicken meat was a bit overcooked, but tasty.  The Vietnamese coffee was a bit off, not as French Roast as I would like.  The menu is so simple, look up, point and pay.  This is Banh Mi I'm used to, so I am a fan.  That part of the city, doesn't have a Vietnamese sandwich place, so it will be my go-to place when I'm craving for a banh mi.  It's so affordable.  I hope they don't raise the prices.
author: Helen L.

description:
Fresh, delicious, affordable. I'm a big fan!

I got the grilled pork, as many people suggested. Well-marinated, well-cooked, minimal fat. Also got some spring rolls, which were fresh and tasty.

Super fast and friendly service. Definitely coming back.
author: Sev G.

description: My first vietnamese sandwich but it was excellent. Lots of fresh vegetables, the meats were savory and the bread was warm and toasted. Nice bit of tang in the dressing too.
author: Will D.

description: Very good sandwiches indeed! A tiny place with one table and a few stools, but still very busy with a huge to-go business.
author: John B.

description: I really like their tofu sandwich and Thai Iced tea!  The bread is crunchy on the outside and not hard to chew! The folks are really friendly, so check out their spot!
author: Joy A.

description:
Probably the tastiest traditional Vietnamese sandwiches on this side of the city.  I'm a big fan of Dinosaurs in upper Market, so I'll use that place as my baseline.  Traditional flavors while Dino's is more 'fusion' - not a bad thing, just depends what you want.

5 stars cause it tastes great and it's cheap - my favorite combo.
author: Leland H.

description: We ordered the grilled pork sandwiches, shrimp and pork spring rolls, and mini egg rolls. Everything was fresh and delicious. Everyone that was working was very nice. We will definitely be back!
author: C F.

description: This is my newly discovered and favorite banh mi spot! I like it more than Saigon Sandwiches. We got the grilled chicken, combination, and ham and pate sandwiches. Their baguettes are the best that I have tried so far in San Francisco - perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The Vietnamese iced coffee was really delicious, too. The people who work there are nice and provide excellent service. I can't wait to try their rice plates and other sandwiches.
author: S. W.

description: There's no constancy in the sandwiches we got. One sandwich had a handful of onions and the other one had 3 slices. We had a combo and a chicken sandwich both were decently good but the bread sucked. I rather go to SJ for banh mi.
author: Trinity N.

description: Best bàn mí this side of the pacific. Every ingredient in the combination #3 was fresh. Bread was amazing, I had it hollow. They didn't stuff too much in so the sandwich was manageable. Coffee was great, served with a smile and the whole meal was affordable. What else do you want?
author: Jasper W.

description: I walked from my airbnb.com after I read the reviews on Yelp. ...the lemongrass Beef was awesome, the pork had the perfect amount of jalepeno it was slap your mama good with  bread that was fresh. Soft inside crusty out I WISH I COULD GO BACK
author: B Rene M.

description:
Thank goodness they opened a bahn mi place here close by. I was tired of driving to Oakland to pick up Ba Le's sandwiches. Ty might not have the variety of food that Ba Le has but their sandwiches are pretty damn comparable.  Bomb ass sandwiches at dirt cheap prices. Best way to fill up. I hope they are here to stick around. 

Tried all their sandwiches and you definitely cannot go wrong with any of them. Fresh ingredients and loaded with flavor.
author: Chai S.

description: Ty sandwiches are delicious. simple yet tasty ingredients. Bread is soft and crunchy. Their Thai ice tea is also really good. Always on my mind when in need of a quick snack.
author: Ryan S.

description: I'm Vietnamese, and the bahnmi here is the best I've ever had. I've been eating bahnmi since I was a baby, and this is the best so far!
author: Rose N.

description: The sandwiches are great. Absolutely flavorful,  but when I asked if she used butter mayo or regular mayo she told me mayo. Then turned around and started talking shit in viet as if I couldn't understand
author: Jennie N.

description:
I might be a White Boy , but I love a good Banh Mi ,  
For me that means a Chewy Roll, a Balanced Mix of Vegis, and a Flavorful Protein.,  

TY has the meat down ,  
Got 2 Sandwiches  , the Tofu , and the Grilled Pork  
As others have pointed out the Shredded Tofu is really nice, and is a much better treatment then serving marinated slabs , I have to give them props for this , also the Pork was rich , and tasty, and in both cases the Protein was Plentiful.

I had issue with the Vegis though that were not balanced on either sandwich , with one dominated by Daikon and no trace of Cilantro, and the other with no hint of Daikon,at all. 

As for the Rolls, the crusts shattered , and lacked that texture that allows your to bite into your sandwich without making a mess , 

So for me it was far from perfect. but I might try them again and see if they improve.given how nice the staff was.
author: Joseph A.

description: I always get the grilled pork banh mi and it is perfect every time! They don't skimp out on the meat and the cashiers are always friendly. Just wish they weren't cash only
author: Maggie L.

description:
My total stay in this restaurant probably lasted no more than a minute... I was in the area, needed something quick to go, found this place highly rated in yelp, and this place delivered.  

I walked in, browsed through the menu, ordered, paid, and they handed me my grilled chicken banh mi with change... they apparently had a large order, so instead of having me wait there, they decided to just hand me one of the sandwiches they just made for the order.  

It was quick and painless, the folks working there were super friendly and obviously accommodating to customers needs... and the banh mi tasted fresh and delicious.  

I would definitely go back and try them the next time I'm in the area...
author: Pete K.

description: This was my first time at this restaurant. The food is fresh and tasty. The customer service is excellent. Tables are clean, your water is refilled without asking. Prices are good too. I will be coming back here regularly.
author: Franek Kuchta F.

description: Just ordering some catering chicken wings for my niece's birthday party.... They love it .... Wings were perfect cook and tasty. They were sweet and salty  and would love to order again
author: Diep L.

description: The banh mi is made with the "football" style bread where it is crunchy and fluffy. Each sandwich cost $4.25 so it is very affordable. The sandwich is average but the value makes it quite worth it. There are spring rolls and egg rolls but they cost more than the sandwich haha. They are pretty good though. The egg rolls are tasty but served with sweet and sour sauce instead of fish sauce. They also sell vietnamese coffee at $2 and it taste pretty good. It's kinda thick but once the ice melts it taste pretty good. Overall for the value and the quality I give this shop a 4 stars. You can also order in advance for pick up on eat 24.
author: Wendy L.

description: On point. Not generally a tofu fan, but the vegetarian Banh Mi is bomb.com. Definitely stop by if passing through South SF/Daly City.
author: Mike D.

description: My favorite sub. I always order the grilled pork. It's perfect. The owners are so friendly and always smiling.
author: Edward P.

description:
grilled chicken rice plate was good
grilled pork vermecelli was good too
author: Diane W.

description: I had a craving for a Vietnamese sandwich for the longest and stumbled on this little place on Mission and Onondaga.  Had a ham and pate sandwich with Thai Iced Tea and it was pretty good, service was quick and the people were friendly.  There are seats available but not enough to accommodate a large group, overall the experience was great.
author: Maria D.

description:
This is a great new sandwich shop that really got the Yelp bump if I've ever seen it before. The inside of this shop is quite small, but with their small menu, it's mostly for to go anyway.

I haven't gotten around to try their sandwiches yet, but their cold drinks have been very consistent and his the spot!

The owner is really nice and allows for any substitution no matter how extensive. That's what you calm customer service! To many more successful years!
author: George Z.

description: I honestly don't think I've ever visited the Excelsior neighborhood before, and the only reason I went this time is because I attended the Golden Gate Dog Show at the Cow Palace (the neighborhood is pretty wonderful, in that it seems to still function to serve the needs of real people, rather than just offer diversions for people with indecent amounts of discretionary money).  I scoured Yelp for somewhere interesting and inexpensive to eat after the show and came up with Ty Sandwich.  They have a limited menu but, that said, my vegetarian boyfriend was happy with his tofu option and so were the meat-eating others in my party of four (we lost a fifth member when she couldn't score reasonable parking).  Delicious!  So glad Yelpers pointed me in the right direction!
author: Rhonda S.

description: Banh Mi Dac Biet here is very good. Good ratio of fillings, tasty pate and generous portions for the $4 price tag. Owners are friendly as well. Nice addition to the hood!
author: Anthony R.

description: Inexpensive and delectable! Right in the heart of the outer mission. The baguette is Vietnamese style, not the long skinny French style you might see at some other Vietnamese sandwich shops. My new spot!
author: Troy V.

description:
#6 Sandwich was good but not amazing, but why 15 minutes for 1 sandwich with no line?

Coffee was good but I rather go down the street for a burrito or visit Chopsticks Chinese for a lunch special.
author: Vance T.

description: One of my favorite banh mi places in the city. Such a hidden gem. Grilled Pork sandwich was nicely done with the right proportions of pickled veggies to pork. Tofu sandwich was sweet and superb. Bread was nicely done, and often breaks the quality of a sandwich when not done right at lesser establishments. Don't miss this place in the little known Mission Street Corridor in the Excelsior.
author: Chris L.

description: Very good sandwich for 4$ in San Francisco. The lady was the cashier and chef. I'm quit impressed with her multitasking skills. The bread was crunchy and soft at the same time. I always get the combination to compare different sandwich places. I'm very satisfied with the proportion of meat, vegetable and bread. I shared my sandwich with my mom and she is also a fan.
author: may q.

description: Extremely nice small place with great food and quick service.
author: Istvan S.

description: A hole in the wall place with very delicious banh mi. A must try if you are craving for banh mi while in SF.
author: Duy P.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE.

I love the sandwiches and the cheap prices for high quality.

The Grilled Pork Sandwich has so much flavor and the bread is toasted, for an extra crunch. 

I've had the grilled chicken sandwich as well. There's nothing wrong with it. It's also delicious. But, I prefer the grilled pork over the grilled chicken.

This is a great place for a quick bite for a great affordable price. 

This will be my go to for banh mi possibly forever.
author: John Y.

description:
Hands down the best banh mi joint in the city.  Rivals the top shops in Houston (Les Givral's, Don's).

Bread is crunchy but not too hard and the pork is finely seasoned and grilled to order.  What more can you ask for?
author: Alex N.

description:
This place is close by my house so I decided to check it out.
Tried the #2, 4, and 6. All of them are so good. The ham and pate sandwich is even better than the ones I get from chinatown! The pate might have a strong taste to some, but to me, it makes the sandwich more flavorful. The grilled chicken and pork are similar but my favorite would be the pork. It taste like korean BBQ! So delicious. I also had the shrimp and pork spring rolls. The peanut sauce they use is a bit different, a darker color, but I love it! I usually don't like peanut sauce much but this one was spectacular. 
Overall, a 5 for the delicious food, quickness, and nice employees who smile genuinely. Definitely coming back! This will become a regular spot for me. :)
author: W L.

description: I love their Grilled Chicken sandwich! The owners are super sweet. They encourage their clients to call it in because they just have to run in and pay. Parking can be a pain sometimes.
author: Betty L.

description: Great lunch spot! They're very fast and food made to order. They put a lot of meat not like a lot of other banh mi spots I've been to. The chicken is my go to since it's always very moist and packed with flavor or the pork is also a great selection too. The spring rolls are also a must try, my favorite is the shrimp and pork but they can put any meat you want. Plus they are always very friendly and polite!
author: Ryan L.

description: It's honestly hole in a wall. A little hard to spot if you don't know this place. Good price, the place is very clean and the food is bomb.
author: Jake Z.

description: Small place with limited seating. Friendly ladies. Ordered a combo banh mi for $4.90 (tax included). It was decent but wasn't as tasty as I'd like it to be. I remember trying to savor the sandwich as I ate it but I don't recall anything special of it. Even as I write this review, the only thing that pops in mind was how spicy the jalapeno was. Overall not bad, but not great.
author: C. C.

description: My go to sandwich place now. I've been using the eat24 app to order however i don't know how reliable it is because this was the first time it was wrong. I didn't receive any carrots in my sandwich when I only asked for no jalapeños and onions. I also requested for extra cilantro but maybe I shouldn't have said that because they took out the carrots? I didn't specify that I didn't want that tho... Maybe they got my order mixed up with someone else's. The sandwich does taste different without the tangy carrots. =\ i still give this place a 4 star because of the taste and portion size. better luck next time.
author: Cori N.

description: Can't say enough about this place. I live in the neighborhood and I'm here at least twice a week. I love the grilled pork sando. Friendly people who make each sandwich fresh to order. Very reasonably priced, especially for the city.
author: Sean S.

description: So glad I followed the reviews to this place!  Fresh and delicious sandwiches (grilled pork!), super friendly service, and all at a good price. Bonus points for dealing with aplomb with the, er, interesting characters who flitted in and out of this tiny joint while I was there - none of whom, to my knowledge, actually bought anything.
author: Amanda P.

description: Finally a great Vietnamese sandwich place in Excelsior! The place is generous for the price you pay. Its worth it. Also the service is wonderful.
author: Kay D.

description:
my new favorite vietnamese sandwich shop in the city!

{ FOOD } 
#2, HAM + PATE :: great flavor and quality (esp the pate)
#6, GRILLED PORK :: flavor town!
PICKLED VEGGIES - got them on the side since we were eating them the next day, this way it mitigates the sandwiches getting soggy 
* veggies aren't sweet like saigon sandwiches, which i prefer
BREAD: slightly smaller than most sandwiches, which is ok by me. great flavor and crunch ratio (outer bread vs. inside bread pillow)

{ SERVICE }
* you don't really have to wait in line, if there is one, it's not long
* getting your actual sandwiches is a little slow (not a well oiled machine like the ladies at saigon sandwich)
* they are very friendly there

{ TIPS }
* cash only
* street parking seems easy, we got one right in the front
* closed on holidays
* if you get your order to go, i suggest getting the veggies on the side (although this is the case for any vietnamese sammy)
author: Tina F.

description: I always like trying out new spots and I heard there was a good Vietnamese sandwich spot so I gave this place a try.  When I walked in, I noticed the menu was pretty simple with a few sandwiches n like one rice dish.  They also had spring rolls.  I ordered the grilled pork sandwich.  It took about 5 mins too make.  This sandwich is legit.  It was flowing with grilled pork and the bread was perfect.  They don't skimp here.  Oh yeah, the ice coffee here is spot on too.
author: Hugh L.

description: This is my favorite Viet Sandwich spot. Not only are the sandwiches and coffee super tasty, cheap, and all around "on point" for a Vietnamese sandwich place, but the staff rocks! The lady working the counter is super cool, a little flirty, and always makes you laugh. Great service, great sandwiches, good times, perfect hangover solution.
author: Rosh T.

description: This place is a whole in the wall. The best thing that ever happened though. I recommend getting the grilled pork sandwich. It is really rich in flavor with ever bite you take. The pork makes the sandwich. hands down the best vietnamese sandwich I ever had and I had mannnnny of them in my lifetime. Price isn't too bad. $4 for a sandwich. you need to try this place out if you are ever in the city or near by.
author: Myphan L.

description: Someone recently said to me the perfect bahn mi would be Castro Tarts ingredients with Dinosaurs bread. These people heard it... the perfect bahn mi in my favorite neighborhood.
author: Monster B.

description: In a pinch this is a great place to grab lunch. The #6 bbq pork sandwich is amazing. Spring rolls are fresh and the staff is super friendly. For a quick awesome Vietnamese sandwich. This is the place to go in the city. In and out in 5 min authentic and home made feel w/ subway time.
author: Aram M.

description: THANKS FOR OPENING! Another reason why I love living nearby is because of great cheap, fast, eats like this place. Their sandwiches are yummy, people are friendly, and next time I just have to try out their drinks! Feels like a subway, vietnamese version! Great for students : )
author: Jamie P.

description: Food was fabulous. The wings and the grilled pork or stellar. I would eat them every day. A great find for sure.
author: Andrew B.

description: Craving it as I write this review. Simple but super tasty sandwiches in crunchy fresh French baguette roll. We ordered a chicken sandwich and the lemongrass beef. Amazing!!! So simple but so full of taste. Iwish this place was closer to my home, but I will still make the trip to SF to eat it over and over again. Thai iced tea also yummy, mango tapioca dessert was great and the fresh spring rolls were to die for. Love the place!!
author: LILLI W.

description: Hmm as far as the grilled pork bahn mi is concerned...5 stars...i had to deduct half a star for the lemon grass beef and chicken, only because the pork out-shined them. The service is super friendly, bumping them back to 5. My only complaint is that i couldn't keep eating, but that would be bad. i did order another grilled pork sandwich for my lunch tomorrow. So yum!
author: elizabeth c.

description: Perfect Banh Mi! Bread crispy but light. Fillings fresh and juicy. Any combo of fillings for $4.25-$4.50. (I get grilled pork + pate.) One of the bigger banh mi sandwiches in SF.
author: Martina S.

description: Great combo sandwhich, lemongrass beef sandwich, chicken sandwich, and eggrolls.  In addition, the workers were very friendly.  The only negatives are location and parking. Definitely need to return to try other things on the menu.
author: Kelvin S.

description:
Wonderful place to grab a sandwich. If you happen to turn into a repeat customer, a warm welcome will accompany your next visit.

Great tasting, solid variety, love the spring rolls (they go fast), superb price and just a great atmosphere that fills the place.

Not on the menu is a new beef sandwich that is really good. Looking forward to the next experiment. The spot is really a great addition to the other food places in the area.
author: Joe E.

description: Random search for a quick bite to eat and it was the best!! Ordered 2 banh mi sandwiches. Grilled pork and combination banh mi is delish! I also ordered their fresh spring rolls and che dessert in fridge along with banh mi all of which were theeee bomb! ^_^ Not only the food was great but the owners or I assume are the ones taking orders/cashiering, cook etc. were soooooo nice, patient and attentive to my indecisiveness. =) This place will now be my #1 go to healthy fast food take-out. Walking/running distance from where I'm residing! I do my daily morning cardio before breakfast and this place is conveniently located to my daily cardio routes! :-)
author: AJ J.

description: Awesome hole in the wall bahn mj spot! I got the shredded tofu bahn mi and it had better flavor than a lot of pork bahn mi I've had. Crusty bread, fresh condiments, and delicious, savory tofu. So good.
author: Andrew W.

description: Actually it was my first time trying Vietnamese, and I think it was a good start. You should put lots and lots of cilantro. It would make the flavor richer.
author: Ilhoon J.

description:
"The Best Banh Mi in SF!"
I have been looking for a good Vietnamese sandwich place in SF for the last 4 years, since we moved here.  Don't get me wrong...there are a few places that make an ok sandwich.  I grew up in San Jose so I have a pretty high standard when it come to Banh Mi.  We're talking Ba Le, Thanh Huong and even Lee's Sandwich (I mean the original shop, before they went all commercial).  

Ty's serves the best Vietnamese sandwiches that I've tasted in SF.  The ham and pate banh mi is the real deal.  I've tried the ham/pate and the grilled pork sandwiches so far and they are awesome.  I do agree with some previous reviewers that the grilled pork is a little in the sweet side, but still good.  I'm looking forward to trying the other sandwiches on future visits.

Welcome to the neighborhood Ty's!  

... thank you for ending my search for an authentic banh mi.
author: Tony T.

description: I haven't been in the area for some time and on the way to El Farolito noticed this place and detoured. The menu was simple and easy to order from. I got a combination sandwich and was quite surprised by the serving size. Tons of pickled carrots and daikon as well as meat.
