I'd say this is the best bánh mì I've had in the Bay Area, this coming from a Vietnamese, SoCal, Little Saigon lovin' girl. The young lady that helped me was nice, too.
author: Em T.

description: Really great sandwiches for a great price (4.50), served up by a warm, friendly family. I have been coming here for about a year, and have checked out most of the menu. The bread is fresh and crackly the way it should be, and the fillings are always generous and fresh. My personal favorite is the grilled pork banh mi--so delicious! And I also adore their chicken wings-they have a splash of funky fish sauce, so be warned if you don't like that. But they are perfection-sweet, salty, crispiness. For 6.00 it's a pretty good size portion, though the wings are smallish. Saigon Sandwiches is still my favorite for Sui Mai banh mi (meatball) but for me TY is easier to get to, is never mobbed, and the grilled pork makes my world go round.
author: Jill T.

description:
I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream... NOT, despite the fact that weather was in the 80's today, I didn't care for it.  btw,  (80s = my definition of suicidal hot, although others might beg to differ)

Anywho, I was in the mood for viet sandwich.

To date I've tried the

-Combo ham
-Chicken
-Tofu 
- Shrimp Spring rolls
-Thai iced tea

It's definitely finger(s)  / lip licking good! My fav, hands down is the chicken sandwich. 

The 411 on the bread
-Delish & flaky. 

The 411 on the fixings
-chicken (moist, juicy) .... i feel like chicken tonight. 
-Tofu (good, lacks a tad bit of sauce)
-Combo ham (standard)
-carrots (too sweet for me)
-Spring rolls (decent. the sauce ehh)
-greens (cilantro & jalapeno), yummy! a must have on viet sandwiches!  

The 411 on the thai tea
-Alright. Nothing special.  

The owner/assistant
Very friendly.  I don't mind being called "Sweetie" all day long.  

*** Enjoy and Be content Man! I liked this place so much that I purposely skip the gym & hook myself up with sandwich. (shhhh!)
author: Judd L.

description: Absolutely hands down the best Bánh mì sandwiches in SF. Everything about these sandwiches is amazing. I just wish they delivered... Or opened another location closer to Noe.
author: Brett R.

description:
hands down best chicken wings 

sandwiches are dope but the wingz are a must have !!!...............................................
author: Marcus M.

description: Tried a couple of different ones and everything was awesome! Definitely the best this side of the city. A couple of places in the Tenderloin might still be marginally better, but it's close.
author: j k.

description: Inexpensive.   Great sized spring rolls.  Light crust roll with good portion of meat.  Prices from $3.75 to $4.25 for a very filling sandwich.  Cash only.  Another place for good cheap food.
author: Edward V.

description: Great Thai sandwiches! They are going on vacation for a month, what will one do? :(
author: Norman C.

description: Sandwiches are awesome, with authentic Vietnamese - style bread, crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. I must admit that I can't get past their combination sandwich but maybe next time. Their shrimp spring rolls are perhaps too generous but very good. I'm now on my way to try their chicken wings.
author: William G.

description: I found this Vietnamese sandwich place when I was going to get a burrito. Ty sandwich is a tiny hole in a wall restaurant but they make bomb vietmanese sandwiches. I always go for the combination sandwich and a thai ice tea. The combination sandwiches loaded with fresh ingredients and taste amazing everytime.
author: Ken K.

description: Friendly staff, delicious grilled chicken banh mi, and very affordable.  I'm a regular!
author: Amber R.

description: I happened to walk by this hidden gem on my way to work. I decided to give it a try and boy was I not disappointed. Their banh mi was exceptional! The baguette has the right amount of crunch on the outside and still maintain a softness on the inside. The fillings are generous too. My favs are the grilled pork and meatball, not over salted with just the right amount of marinade. The grilled chicken was good. The spring rolls are well made. I had the combo grilled pork and shrimp and it was delish! To top off the meal is to wash it down with a thai ice tea.  The prices are very good. A banh mi, combo spring roll and thai iced tea was $12.99. You can't beat the price for the amount of food you get. When I'm craving for banh mi I come here now. It's better than the places in the Tenderloin.  Parking can be difficult but I've always managed to find a meter spot.
author: j h.

description: This place has to be the best Vietnamese sandwich spot in San Francisco. It just melts in your mouth it's so good, lol and to top it off it's only $5 bucks it doesn't get any better. Me and the ppl from my job always order our lunch from here. Oh and must I add the tai iced teas are on point. I would definitely recommend anyone in the neighborhood to stop and grab a sandwich.
author: Amanda s.

description: Omg. So delicious and thank the viet sandwich Gods for finally putting a DELISH viet sandwich place in this area!!!  The lady who runs the cashier is super friendly and adorable. Even though she got my sandwich and drink wrong, she gave me DELISH alternative so I can't complain :) I will be back again and again and again for the nice service, fresh bread, veggies and freshly grilled meat.
author: HT T.

description: Cool new place.  Yummy sandwiches, especially the pate that was spread on the combo.  The couple running the place is really friendly.  GOOD LUCK, GUYS!  Keep up the friendly atmosphere & yummy food.
author: Zarah L.

description: These sandwichs are delicious. Went for the first time yesterday. And went back today, I will be there tomorrow also.
author: Marie P.

description: Omg I'm sooooo glad to have stumbled on this place while wandering around the post office near by! They've been open for like 4 months and it's owned and ran by a cute and super friendly couple. Their menu is simple, which means they put more heart into perfecting the few items they do have. So I ordered the grilled pork sandwich with a Vietnamese iced coffee. BOMBASS sandwich! In my opinion, it rivals Saigon Sandwiches in the TL; impossible you say? I thought so too, but I was really impressed! This place is a little hole in the wall and seating is limited but if you live in the area and are craving these Bahn Mis then you don't have to go downtown for a delicious sandwich. I haven't tried anything else yet but I will sure be back! I'm so thrilled that they're close to me! My order ran about 7 bucks plus tax. As I sat there munchin', I was paying attention to their customers and it seemed to me everyone who came here were hooked just as I was. The owners are super sweet and cute. They're a young couple, just trying to make it out here in the tough food industry but they're doing a great job so far!; they also seem to care and remember their customers which is always a good thing. Oh yeah, their iced coffee is straight up crack.
author: Lina L.

description: these are mediocre vietnamese sandwiches at best. there wasn't anything particularly great or extra flavorful about them so i'm not understanding the five star rating. i've read the bread:meat ratio is potentially raising it's ratings but my sandwich failed to match the words of these other yelp reviews.
author: Regina C.

description: Yummy! I tried this place for the first time today and had the Ham with Pate and the Chicken sandwich. The bread was fresh, warm and flaky on the outside and soft in the inside. The Ham and Pate was very tasty and the Chicken was very tender and tasty as well. I like the Jalapenos, gave it a very nice kick! The lady at the register was very sweet and friendly. The dude cooking in the back was just as friendly too when my son needed to use the restroom. Both of them were all smiles and very welcoming. I will definitely be back!
author: Ravenous T.

description:
I'm almost worried to give this place an excellent review because the next thing you know, it's hipster central with long lines. Do yourself a favor and ask for the beef lemongrass banh mi (it's not on their poster menu), but it's one of the best sandwiches I've eaten in the bay area (in the league of pal's takeway, il carne rosso, ike's etc). Notice I didn't include saigon sandwiches in that list. Why? Because -- yes, I dare the universe by saying this -- their beef lemongrass banh mi is way better than anything I've tried at Saigon. The meat to bread ratio is perfect (Saigon's is too bready for me). You get a satisfying portion of meat in every bite, along with the fresh crunch of carrots, cilantro, jalapenos and cucumbers (I think?). But what puts this sandwich over the top is the amazing dressing on the sandwich -- I'm not sure if this was the marinade of the beef lemongrass or some kind of sauce they put on every sandwich, but it was divine. It tasted like a combo of siraccha, tamarind, tomato ketchup, and fish sauce. And despite the pungent (yeah, it's spicy!) flavor of this sauce, you taste the gorgeous freshness of lemongrass in every bite.
Fantastic sandwich, and sets you back 5 dollars.  Couldn't ask for a better deal. My prediction is that we will be seeing this on 7x7 lists soon...it deserves it. On second thoughts, stay away. I don't want the lines. Cash only!
author: Crushed Wi Cardamom C.

description: Great family run sandwich shop. The people there are so nice. The food is fresh and done right. Great prices. What not to love? I have no idea why anyone would go next door to subway instead of of Ty`s.
author: Tony N.

description: Excellent tofu (vegan w/o the mayo) banh mi - extremely friendly staff, fast service, knows us already! Gem of Excelsior... glad they've opened up here - I can call to order before and she knows to add extra peppers! =)
author: prasanthi p.

description: I love this place! It's close to my house and they have great, cheap food. When you walk in they are always so friendly and make you feel comfortable. The food is great, I love the grilled pork the best. They're Vietnamese ice coffee is also super good!
author: Rachel C.

description: Man oh man let me tell you I didn't see this place till yesterday n I gotta say its a good spot and as we speak in back again meaning its fuckin good as fuuuuck lol just saying but overall I like this spot I'm bouta try the Thai ice tea hopefully it'll be good I'm definitely goin to come back
author: Mario M.

description: This place has great sandwiches for $4 each! The sandwiches comes with shredded carrots, onions, jalapeños, and cilantro. I come here often and I've tried the grilled chicken, grilled pork, and combination and they're all good! The owners are a young married couple and they have the cutest little daughter. They are sweet and hardworking people. This place is great! The area needed a place like this with great vietnamese sandwiches and nice customer service.
author: Jasmin W.

description:
A wonderful, quaint, and simply happy sandwich shop located in the heart of the excelsior. This has now become my one of my favorite places to grab my dinner in the entire are. Since opening, I have been there probably five times with now the staff, whom should be all well respected and given full credit for their work ethic and warm heart smiles (of whom they all now remember my face once I walk in, making the experience even more enjoyable). Their menu selection is simple however each item they make is created with the up-most care and packed with flavor. Upon ordering your food, you wont have to wait to long and the energy of the staff and cozy looking interior make the time go by faster. Best of all, on a tight budget you can still grab one of their signature Banh Mi sandwiches for $4.00! You can get a sandwich made with more love, care, and taste than a $5.00 foot long at subway any day. 
Residents of the area need to check out this location as soon as they have a chance; People waiting to get on the MUNI go grab a sandwich while you wait; Those who search for special hole in the wall restaurants come out and check it out.

When you do, I guarantee you will go back again and again. If you cant decide, get my special: Number Six (Pork) with no jalapeno and extra carrots.
author: Alexander F.

description: I got an awesome grilled chicken sandwich and an order of the spring rolls. You seriously wont be disappointed if you come here.
author: Dom L.

description: came back on friday afternoon for good banh mi.  a little disappointed today.  the bread today was so so.  we ordered tofu and grilled chicken.  the tofu was not our cup of tea.  it was dry and tasteless.  the grilled chicken was on the other hand was very good.  it smelled terrific and tasted goood
author: Bill L.
